Mouthfeel is simultaneously thin on front and back, and murky in the middle. Finish is roasty charred chocolate, hershey syrup, strong oak, bourbon. Disjointed. Not horrible but a bit of a let down after everything I had heard. Would take regular Expedition over this any day.
A: coffee, chocolate, Bourbon. Ap: pitch black with a reddish tinge. T: bitter with a little sweetness. P: Bourbon, sweet, long lasting. O: exceptional beer that I would love to try aged.
12 ounce bottle from Timfoolery, some hoppiness, sweet, cherry, espresso, bitter finish.

Thanks to gumballdust for the bottle. This is my first Black Note and needless to say, Ive really been looking forward to cracking this one open. Pours a thick, deep deep brown with a nice one finger caramel color head. The aroma hits you as soon as you start pouring the beer. Licorice, vanilla, bourbon, and dark fruits. Very nice aroma. Flavor is complex, yet very enjoyable. Slightly spicy, coffee beans, vanilla, booze, brown sugar, dark chocolate, caramel. The mouthfeel is thick and velvety smooth. Probably has the best mouthfeel of any stout Ive ever had. They really nailed that aspect of it. I cant imagine a stout getting much better than this.

shared a 2012 bottle with a friend. poured dark black with a small mocha head. chocolate, bourbon, raisins, caramel, coffee is almost gone here. toffee. incredible complex taste of the use of 2 bears. its real smooth and complex beer and im really happy i get to try it!. I expected it to be a lote more thicker do. and I dont think its worth to age it.

Vintage 2014, this is a sugary sweet imperial stout. Tastes of toffee, while the bourbon barrel aging mellows out the sweetness. For a beer of this abv, it is remarkably easy drinking. Very enjoyable!

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2015 Pours black with no head. Nose is roast, dark fruits maybe cherry, touch of bourbon, burnt sugar, milk chocolate, touch milky, a bit of barrel. Taste is dark fruits, milk chocolate, cherry, bit milky, I dont taste the 11% at all. Creamy and excellent mouthfeel. This beer truly is great. 

1 year later, tastes and smells like chocolate covered raspberry, boozy, a good amount of barrel, lots of milk chocolate, a bit of bitterness on the finish, not overly sweet. Still so good.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 Bottle to glass. Random find at west Lakeview liquors in Chicago. Pours a deep black with a thin creamy light brown head. Aroma is a beautiful roasted malts, oak, vanilla, bourbon, dark fruits, very complex. Flavor is sweet roasted malts, light coffee, some bitterness, choclatey sweetness. Full body with a creamy mouth feel and a lingering dark roasted sweetness. Extraordinary! Got one more that will have to age a few years before the next try.

Bottle shared with mrbunn courtesy of coyotehunter. Smells like dark fruit, anise, and motor oil, but the good kind. No foam to speak of, and super awful, frightening dark. Taste is crazy smooth and almost light compared to the nose. Delicious, like sweet black candy with booze mixed in. Delicious and complex with the majority of the taste coming late in the palate. We likes it. I prefer deliverance, but this is such a close second as to not matter. Great.
Jekyl: first few sips and wow... strong chocolate, caramel, and a little bourbon. Hyde: after that then all bourbon, very little choc and caramel. Must be user error.

Appearance - 5 - Dark brown/black beer with a dark tan head that dissapears pretty quickly due to the high ABV.
Aroma - 10 - Huge bourbon barrel characteristics, bourbon, toasted coconut, vanilla, coffee, chocolate, dark chocolate backbone. 
Taste - 10 - Huge creamy dark chocolate backbone, smooth bourbon, coconut, toasted oak, vanilla, cream, umami
Mouthfeel - 5 - Super heavy mouthfeel, like a chocolate milkshake in beer form. Alc is a little warming but thats totally understandable at 11.4% ABV. Aftertaste is mainly coffee, with a touch of the bourbon barrel characteristics. 
Overall - 20 - Possibly the best beer Ive ever had. Id love to compare it to FW Parabola, but well see if that ever happens...
Only downfall is the mouthfeel. Taste and aroma really bring out the bourbon barrel and are awesome.

12oz bottle. Black as the eyes of night. Aromas of Malted chocolate balls ( like a Whopper), with booze drifting off the top. Nothing stands out, because its a perfect creamy blend of dark fruit flavors, malts, chocolates, Bourbon, and coffee. A very soft sweetness countered by the hops and bitter black malts. Damn! its good!

I have nothing wrong to say about this beautiful crafted beer! Smokey bourbon flavors coffe dark fruits! Its the best stout I think Ive ever had! Its a real big beer bought two bottles going to cellar the other for a good year our so it will only get better! Its really hard to find but if you can find it PICK IT UP!

Purchased at Irving Park Liquors in Chicago, IL (last 4 pack!!!!); enjoyed at home on a Friday night getting ready to watch playoff hockey. Man am I happy to be trying this one! Appearance is a rich pitch black with a moderate dark tan head that nicely dissipates. Aroma is really complex, with great dark chocolate and coffee notes, mixed with bourbon, mint, light vanilla, light oak barrel, like BCBS but more subdued/delicate even? Maybe that doesnt make sense, but it smells pretty incredible. Taste is pretty great, light burn going down, light carbonation, rich chocolate notes and lasting coffee...goes well with peanut butter cake! This is a good one, will definitely save one or two for aging.

Wow. Aroma is incredible bourbon. Taste is bourbon, malt, chocolate, espresso. Strong bourbon flavor from start to finish. Really full bodied, creamy mouthfeel. Really impressive. This beer lives up to its billing.

I lucked into this special release when purchasing KBS. What a special surprise. I found to be more balanced with out the bourbon kick/burn at the end. Smooth from start to finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This pours a very dark brown/ black color with almost no head. The aroma is strong with bourbon and sweet robust malts. The taste is sweet, smooth and strong. This seems to be thinner in texture than most other bourbon barrel stout, but probably has the most unique taste that leaves a tart fruit after taste. A good, well made beer but to currently hold the #7 spot for best beer is a bit of a stretch.
Honestly a well crafted beer but just way too much dried fruit and not enough coffee and bourbon for me.

Pours thick black like used motor oil with a small dark chocolate head that left a bit of lacing. Huge aroma of bourbon, oak, roasted malts, alcohol, dark fruits, black licorice, coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate, smoke. Taste is huge and complex! Pretty much everything just mentioned in the aroma but intensified. Alcohol is not hidden at all, right up front with the bourbon. Great alcohol burn going down. Amazing long finish of roasted malts, chocolate, and alcohol. Very full bodied, thick and chewy texture, average carbonation. Outstanding beer!

Thick black brown pour with no head. Very intense and complex aroma: molasses, lots of bourbon, charred wood adds some smokiness (nice twist!), some caramel and ripe fruits (plums, figs). Awesome. Taste is very rich, lots of roasted malts, bourbon, vanilla and chocolate. Flavors are enhanced by the sublime creamy mouthfeel and low carbonation. Intense and refined. Side-by-side with BA speedway with BA speedway being a close winner. Although I prefered Black Notes palate and aroma, BA speedways flavors were out of this world.

Enjoyed a tasting of the 2014 vintage of this outstanding stout at Delilahs. Wow, this is one smooth beer. The chocolate notes come up big on the front end, with the bourbon aging giving this a soft boozy undertone rather than taking over the whole flavor profile. More full bodied than KBS with a lighter mouthfeel than BCS. Unique for this style, and absolutely top class.

Black with a thin tan head. Aroma is dark fruit with a bit of sweet alcohol. Flavor is sweet, dark candy and a tiny bit of bitterness. 

Wife: 4.5

This is a monster of a beer. Very Carmelly and vanilla flavored. Pours dark brown and smelks like vanilla. Had at dark lord 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amazing beer, loads of bourbon sweetness up front, vanilla and oakyness, followed by some malty flavors and coffee + chocolate. Great mouthfeel, this beer is just clearly one of the best, It ages well as well, bourbon flavor is subdued a little bit and it gets more passive instead of being the first and most smack in the face flavor ever.

Bottle 2014 a few months old. Pours with a tan head and thick legs. Aroma is big rich roast, sweet dark chocolate, a bit of espresso acids, Bourbon. The flavor is similar with a substantial clean bitterness and heat balancing out the sweetness. Feel is slick, somewhat lively, but the alcohol and wood take over. Its potent monster but very well put together. Definitely enjoying this more than the draught KBS I had two nights ago.

12 oz bottle. 2014. Was only able to buy one 12 oz bottle. Very good bourbon barrel stout. I think I liked kbs better. A bit too sweet and boozy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

4/22/14. 2014 bottle. Pours jet black with a thin mocha head. Bourbon and cherry/dark fruit nose. Deep dark complex mouth with lots of hop and chocolate bitterness balanced with fruit and alcohol. Super big but nothing dominates. Yummy! Wish I had more to put up because it will age well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Finally! 2014 Bottle. Pours opaque brown-black with a fizzy light brown head. Aroma is bourbon, chocolate, molasses, more cocoa, wood, earth, syrupy, caramel, hint of coffee, toffee, alcohol. Smells amazing. Taste is remarkable; huge flavor profile, coffee, chocolate, caramel, espresso, light herbal bitterness, bourbon, wood, creaminess; finish is bitter chocolate and espresso. Nice laces throughout. Low carbonation. Rich, full, syrupy mouth feel. This is fantastic. World class beer.
Fantastic beer, 2014. Bourbon is present but well balanced throught. Again this year one of the best beers....an event ever year, cheers!
Wonderful beer, complex aroma of dark fruit, bourbon, ripe cherries. Taste is bourbon, cherries, dark fruits, malt, coffee, and some alcohol. Long coffee and fruity aftertaste.

2012 bottle tasted 4/2014. Generously shared by BLADT. 

Rum raisin cake nose. Very strong smell. Fatty butteriness, thick and smooth. Roasted chocolate and whiskey finish. Medicinal sweetness. Prefer KBS, but an unbelievably distinct beer taste.

2012 bottle. Pours very dark, like motor oil. Quickly disappearing beige head. Nose is booze cake and raisons, almost buttery at times, with subtle roasted beans. Taste is remarkably smooth and balanced. Full bodied. The pieces here fit together perfectly. Elements of chocolate, rum cake, plums, and rye. A true sipper. I really enjoyed this.

Bottle: pours deep black with a nice thick tan head. Aromas are bourbon, booze and fruit. Taste is a wonderful balance of dark fruit and booze with some chocolate. This is balanced wonderfully and I love the great bourbon finish. Amazing example of a bourbon stout. Love it.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks DSG. Bottled 12/28/12. Pours opaque black with a small brown head, aroma of chocolate, bourbon, wood, coconut, vanilla, toffee and coffee, flavor of chocolate, bourbon, wood, vanilla, toffee and coffee, full bodied. Great.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2015 2014 bottle at Four Roses Cafe, Plainview Michigan. Black with quickly dissipating foam. Aroma is nice blend of bourbon and dark malt with neither being overwhelming or astringent. Taste is creamy to begin with, bourbon blending in nicely, bit of licorice tang, mild vanilla, bitter finish; beautiful. Unlike many imperial stouts this one doesnt jump around trying to impress, but is both interesting and so well crafted. Delicious. Abv is extremely well hidden. Finish is slightly bitter with some subtle but distinct bourbon barrel character. Gold. Overall, perhaps my favorite beer now - could drink a few of these mainly cause it is neither astringent or over the top with bourbon. Great times!

Pours black with a tan head into a snifter. No light comes through, even when held up to the sun.

 Im outside and am still assaulted by the aroma of bourbon, faint roasted malts, and chocolate, even though the glass is two feet away from me. 

Taste is of strong bourbon, some bittersweet chocolate, and some coffee. Very well balanced. Bourbon is powerful, but not overly so. Delicious. 

Smooth an silky on the mouth. 

Overall, this is one of the best beers Ive tried. Been looking for it forever, and finally found it. As good as BCBS, maybe better.

Ive wanted to try this for years - I finally found it on local shelves. The appearance is an oily black with a lasting beige meringue head. No light passes through the glass when backlit, and appears still. The aroma is sweet bourbon booziness with slight chocolate bitterness, and a hint of freshly ground coffee beans. Taste - intense bourbon with notes of dark roasted coffee upfront, quickly fading to a freshly cut moist cigar on the back with lingering bourbon bite combined with the bite of bourbon left on the tongue. Palate - Viscosity of lowfat milk and smaller-sized CO2 bubbles make for a silky mouthfeel. Overall, an outstanding blend - I look forward to aging several of these. Doubtless this beer ages very well.

2014 Vintage

Black with a thing brown head that fades away after a couple minutes. Aroma of bourbon, oak, chocolate malts, vanilla and roasted barley. Flavors of chocolate, strong oak, vanilla, and roasted barley. Heavy body with some mild carbaonation. Very Tasty!

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2014 Update:  The aroma on this is an 11+.  Seriously, the best aroma Ive experienced in an Imperial Stout.  +1 overall, +1 appearance..  This is a seriously good beer.  
2014 release. Pours a thick, oily dark brown, leaving a short-lived rich brown head. Aroma is outstanding, with sweet vanilla, light bourbon, earthy wood, dark fruit, and semi-sweet chocolate. Taste is creamy with chocolate, butterscotch, rich caramel up front. The sweetness is balanced with a more bitter chocolate in the middle, drying out with some resin, into slight alcohol warming, leaving a mellow cocoa toffee molasses aftertaste. This is really, really smooth. I have to do a side by side of this and Bourbon County Stout. From what I can recall, this is mellower, with just a bit less in-your-face flavor and richness, sacrificing that slightly to gain an unreal drinkability. I could have 4 of these in a row, and I cant say that about Goose Islands. Coffee is almost nowhere, replaced with a sweeter lactose flavors instead. More on my side of the spectrum in that regard. It could get cloying on the 2nd or 3rd bottle, but this beer is too expensive and rare to test that theory. Balanced, mellow, drinkable. This bottle is less than a month old. Any points Ive docked could very well be erased with aging. Well see!
On tap at Parlor City during a Bells tap takeover. Holy crap is this good! You get the best of both Expedition and Double Cream.

This beer has eluded me for quite some time. Thank god ericteusink comes in to save the day. Bourbon and vanilla here are really nice. Plum and vanilla aromas. Flavor is smooth creamy and rich. Vanilla and chocolate malt all overthr palate. Age and barrel and beer come together so well here. All other barrel beers take note.
Pours a rich dark brown almost black. Aroma is bourbon, boozy, dark sugary fruit, and chocolate. Tatse is epic, very bold with bourbon and sweet dark fruits. This is an excellent brew.
Oh wow. This is damn good. The aroma hit me as it was sitting on the counter. Almost hard to decide which I like better, this or expedition stout.

330 ml bottle at home. Pours pitch black with small quickly dissapating head. Typical American bourbon RIS nose: lots of bourbon alcohol, tad of vanilla, lots of roasted malts. Medium body with roasted undertone, alcohol heat. Taste is one of the best/most marvelous toffee characters I have ever tasted. Overall OK.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks DSG. 2012 Bottle. Black with tan head. Ink, roast, then cherry and port aroma, slightly sweetish and slightly roasty in the mouth. Smooth, no carbonation, full-bodied, faint roasty undertones. Good!

At a tasting, thanks DSG, pitch black colour, aroma of wood, coffee, cocoa, and milk chocolate, flavour of coffee, dark choclate, dark fruit. some fudge and bread with hints of vanila in the back, the bourbon character is suprisingly subdued, and integrated and not in your face. Very good.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2016 Re-rate 3/12/16: Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Tom L. Bottled 3/12/14. Black. Great aroma of chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, cookies. Sweet flavor with chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, mild bitterness. Full-bodied. Great stuff. 8/4/8/4/17=4.1

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks troganmi for this bottle! Bottled 12/28/12. Black with some brown foam. Lovely aroma with lots of coffee, dark chocolate, some vanilla, a bit of bourbon, a bit of coconut and a bit of alcohol. Sweet flavor with lots of dark chocolate, some coffee, roastiness, bourbon, vanilla, wood and a finish with an alcoholic touch. Great full body, slightly oily. A great one. 8/4/8/5/16=4.1

Courtesy of nbutler11 on the eve of his nuptials. Huge fuckin beer. Super black with very inviting head. Complex whirlwind of toffee, vanilla, spiced coffee and smooth, almost evaporated bourbon. Not cloying at all.

Sample the Autumn Brew Review in Minneapolis. This was by far my favorite beer at this event. Dark with khaki head. It is creamy with chocolate, coffee, and bourbon notes. Nice balance as none of them overpower you. I could of had this all afternoon.

2012 bottle cracked open in early 2014. Pours black with caramel bordering, no head. Smells of maple syrup, some faint chocolate, raisin notes. Taste is smooth, sweet, and heavy. Caramel, bourbon, char...all hitting high notes on this one. Smooth and dangerously easy to sip. Loved it.

Draft at 3 Kings St. Louis. Nice amount of lacy rich brown head on top of a super black pour. Nose is an amazing sense of all things at once. Cocoa, Licorice, Coffee, Brown Sugar, Vanilla, Honey, Leather and Bourbon. Wow! Wonderfully rich but not sticky thick. Great roundness of cream and sweetness with just a hint of oaky grainyness. Perhaps the best BA Stout Ive ever had. Just the right amount of everything Chocolate, Vanilla, Coffee, Spice and Bourbon Barrel. The best part of this beer may be the lack of hot alcohol behind it to overpower it. I think it was listed as 11.something but it certainly doesnt present the alcohol in a manner where you guess that. Crazy long bittersweet finish that has an almost bizarrely familiar Cake Box Tobacco edge. This beer is the most perfectly executed BA Stout Ive ever found. Wow.

A big thank you to my cousin for cracking this open, which we shared while watching the great Seahawks come from behind to beat the despised 49ers in the NFC championship game. A really amazing beer with a fantastic taste - blueberry, lots of malty sweetness, plus dashes of port and lemon. I dont recall what year it was from.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2015 At wbf... pours dark and with a tan head... chocolate coffee and a lot of bourbon come through... The taste stays on your palate longer than any beer I have ever had... fantastic!

Bells Black Note Stout is a perfectly balanced stout. Pour is very dark with a tight, soft tan head. Aroma is very light subtle aroma of bourbon and chocolate notes. Taste is creamy delicious with chocolate, coffee, oak and bourbon notes that dont overpower. The beer has a pleasant thick mouthfeel with an aftertaste that lasts long after the last sip. Black Note might be the ultimate Imperial Stout! Well done.

(bottle - 12 oz - 2012 vintage) Dark black pour with a puffy tan head. A wonderful aroma of bourbon mixed with coffee and cream and vanilla. Heavy coffee at the start of the flavor with a nice transition to a smooth creamy bourbon and vanilla finish. Some light bitterness on the aftertaste. Really tasty.
2012 bottle. Poured black. Sweet bourbon, coffee and wood aroma. Chocolate/coffee start that moves into vanilla and caramel bourbon richness. Almost a bit of leather. Really good bottle.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2014 Bottle shared at Scopeys 5000th rate. A huge thanks to Bruce for a beer I never thought I would get. Pours black with a tan rim which is very sticky. Nose is very sweet vanilla - huge vanilla macaron, vanilla bean, white chocolate, chocolate biscuit and big bourbon spice. Absolutely chock full of creamy vanilla in the taste. It really does remind of me of an amazing vanilla macaroon. Loads of creamy milk chocolate with plenty of vanilla sweetness, a good dose of bourbon, touch of spice. Almost a mocha like finish to it. Very creamy stuff and sweet as shit but it works. A nice bitter finish with a slight kick of heat. Nice depth and usage of the barrel here. For the sweet tooths. Its very good, but like with most hyped beers, not amazing

Bottle split at Scopeys 5K Extravaganza of Oompah Band meets doorbell music, big thanks to Bruce for supplying this vaulable catch up rate - 15/02/14.
Light black with a moderate tan covering that thins to a swirl.
Nose is big roast, dark chocolate fudge, coconut shavings - some may say Classic Bounty Bar - red wrapper with cardboard insert naturlich, subtle oaky bourbonic drawl.
Taste comprises dark chocolate, dark toffee fudge, touch of spice, light coconut, subtle oaky bourbon, lightly oiled booze.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, smooth on the palate.
A solid BA impy for sure, not overcooked on the BA either, could drink this one every day!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Draft. Very very smooth. I was worried about the double cream blend. No worries. Nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft a few months ago at the Thirsty Monk. Great mellow taste for such a big beer. Not much heat at all.

The Holy Grail of BBA Stouts. Words cannot do this beer justice, so Im not even going to try.

Each bottle should come with a new pair of underwear.

Bottle share thanks to Homer321. Pours a deep dark thick black syrupy with light brown head. Big boozy nose, lots of oak and barrel character, molasses, chocolate, very complex. Thick and boozy. Oaky, mor molasses and caramel flavor, follows with chocolate. Very tasty beer!

Bottle thanks to Andrew. Pours black with smallish beige head. The nose on this one is oak barrel, vanilla extract, bourbon spice, and slight cinnamon doughnut. The taste is straightforward and excellent, with dark chocolate, roasted coffee bean, slightly drying oak, and sweet bourbon. Everything in balance, well done.

At last! Ive been wanting to try this brew for so long! On tap, jet black pour with a tan head. Aromas of bourbon, chocolate, oak, coffee, and nice roasted malts. Flavor is nice bourbon/caramel at first with chocolate and oak in the finish. So good! Abv is very well-hidden and its so smooth on the palate. Definitely lives up to the hype! A truly great beer and one of the best impy stouts Ive ever had.
UPDATED: FEB 5, 2014 Super complex... This is a huge beer! So many flavors that intertwine to make this glorious stout symphony. This is a must have

Had this in tap at Al's if hampden for a tap takeover last month. Pour is black as night, has a off white head about one finger high. Nose is of sweet chocolate, and huge bourbon notes. Also pick up some radiated coffee and malt. Taste doesn't disappoint. Huge sweet bourbon that is nice. Alcohol is there but doesn't overpower. Very very good. Would love to get a bottle to lay back sometime.

Bottle @ home on adnielsens 30th bday. Pours black with a light tan head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, roasty. Flavor is bourbon, coffee, dark fruits, bourbon, oak, chocolate, This is one fantastic beer.

12 oz. bottle 2012 vintage. Great appearance. Nose is fantastic. Light bourbon over day old coffee and cream, dark sweet chocolate and subtle vanilla oak. Snap!! This sat just long enough. No bourbon alcohol burn, just sweet and smooth all the way down. Of course need I mention the rich cocoa, dry roasted malts, brownie matter and subtle oak? Should I also explain the full body with an oily texture that screams take another sip? I like to age all my BBA stouts about a year in time. This has been one of the best examples I have tasted. The bourbon and roasted flavor linger ridiculously long after the sip. Down.... Right.... Bad.... Ass. Nothing else to state here.

Woot! Hex kbuddddddd. Smells incredible. White choco, licorice faded away almost totally, sweet spice is mild, light soy sauce, deep roasted oats, excellent choco, wonderfully oaky and vanillaeee, borderline melted brown sugar. Finally had to succum to drinking this. Melted medium choco of good sweetness and balanced bitterness, coconut, vanilla, suckable nose burn, mellow oak, slight caramel or toffee or whatever, heavy roast that is not remotely sweet. Enjoyable all around. Excellent brew.

Bottle to tulip
Soy, blackstrap molasses, caramel, cream.
Dark brown, no head.
A little coffee, dark chocolate, cream, and soy.
Very interesting...Im enjoying this.

Bottle - Vintage 2012 - Bells usual soy and sweet bitter notes. Jet black with a thin brown head. Soy, coffee, chocolate and a nice sweet finish. Big rich mouthfeel which is what I love about these beers. The soy is a bit much for me.

Bottle shared big thanks to Kermis. Poured a clear dark brown colour with a round bubbly tan head. The aroma is truly amazing with lots of malts rich vanilla bourbon and oaky notes. The flavour is strong bitter with a super smooth bubbly yeast alcoholic liqourice palate. Full bodied with flat carbonation and a lovely oily mouthfeel. The alcohol is very well controlled given the ABV. A superb beer fully deserving of its rating.

Brown bottle, 1 pint 9.4 ounces, from Philippe Boutin, with Louise, Luc Bourbonnière and Philippe, savoured on September 13 2013; eye: black, opaque, no effervescence, no head, no lacing; nose: roasted barley, coffee, chocolate, light alcohol, bourbon; mouth: roasted barley, coffee, chocolate, light alcohol, bourbon, light alcohol, acidity, hops, finale in roasted barley with presence of chocolate, full body, below-average carbonation, slightly sweet, lightly bitter, oily texture; overall: quite fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Bouteille brune, 1 pinte 9,4 onces, de Philippe Boutin, avec Louise, Luc Bourbonnière et Philippe, savourée le 13 septembre 2013; il : noire, opaque, pas deffervescence, pas de mousse, pas de dentelle; nez : orge torréfiée, café, chocolat, léger alcool, bourbon; bouche : orge torréfiée, café, chocolat, léger alcool, bourbon, léger alcool, acidité, houblon, finale en orge torréfiée avec présence de chocolat, corsée, carbonatation sous la moyenne, très légèrement sucrée, légèrement amère, texture huileuse; en résumé : bien bon

Poured into 5oz at new years day event. Pours a thick dark slick color with minimal head. Bourbon is easily noticeable but blends very well with the underlying tones of coffee and chocolate with maybe even a hint of dark fruit. Flavor is upfront with the bourbon and roasted malt notes and a heavy alcohol presence. Turns into a nice chocolate coffee mixture with a slight burn from the alcohol in the back end. Mouth feel is bitter and only slightly sweet. Carbonation is low and I think could benefit more. Phenomenal beer I would love to have again.

2012 bottle. Generously sent from Summer Secret Santa. The pour is black with a flimsy head on top that never fully develops. The aroma is of raisins, leather, light on the bourbon, some wood, and also a touch of licorice. Kind of underwhelming in that department. Warming, smooth, and silky in the mouth. Much more chocolaty than the scent had me thinking it would be, which was a good thing. Bourbon barrel notes, alcohol-soaked raisins, light sooty ash, and licorice provide some nice depth and a good blend of flavors. Some sticky sweetness in the finish is the only thing preventing this from being a very highly drinkable 10% beer. Not as big or creamy in the body as expected. A very good beer but probably a little over-hyped, as many barrel-aged Imperial Stouts seem to be.

Delar en flaska med morsan i juletider. (Trade med Biggsbowler, thanks!). Underbar elegant bourbon och choklad i doften. Rund och len. Mild smak av kaffe och lyxig mörk choklad. Balanserad och riktigt härlig. Kul att morsan gillade den också. Testade Sigtunas bourbon precis före och vi är båda rörande överens om att en här är oerhört mycket bättre. Troligen sista topp-50 krysset för i år. Härligt avslut på 2013.

Poured from a bottle during Christmas party (2013) at Galbo's. I had been sitting on this one all year until Christmas, and was it worth the wait. Unbelievable beer. Pours a thick, oily dark black color with very small head. Aroma was wonderful and complex: malts, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon. And the taste is smooth for such high ABV. It was actually semi-sweet, but not too much. Great balance. It has a smooth and creamy texture to it. Overall, this beer is at the top of the list for me regarding stouts. Great work Bells!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12oz bottle pours an oily black with zero head. Chocolate and oak aroma. Vanilla chocolate and slight bourbon taste. Very drinkable no real boozy taste for such high alcohol.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2015 Big thanks to Bruce for sharing this tonight. 750 ml bottle, corked and caged. Vanilla, chocolate, some nicely placed oxidation, bourbon. Hell yeah. Full body, slick texture, light carbonation. Impressive beer. My comments? Unimpressive, but thats what you get when youre tasting a bunch of awesome beers with cool people and you dont want to be typing away into your phone all night. Maybe Ill come across one of these again and then Ill sit down and take careful notes, but not tonight. Besides, does anybody even read these comments anyway?

 
Ive had this a few times since, always been in the 4.1-4.3 range. Just had it as part of an imperial stout blind tasting, though, and am adding that + adjusting rating down slightly. Sample 4 of 13: Holy graham cracker. Super dark, clear, thick pour. Ruby highlights. Graham cracker and vanilla. Barrel-aged? Taste is drier than the last, and theres some cardboard. Nutty/roasty, and much more balanced than the last. Chocolatey. Nice. Very pleasant. 8/4/7.5/4/15.5 = 3.9. As a result, dropping from 4.3 to 4.2.
Big thank you to CraftyCarl21. Its crazy how drinkable this beer is. Very creamy, not hot, flavor goes for days (lots of chocolate, bourbon, vanilla. Incredibly good.

12oz bottle, many thanks craftycarl21. Small tan head atop dark brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, Bourbon, prune, some vanilla, bittersweet chocolate. Taste is sweet, milk chocolate, prune/raisin, some Bourbon, caramel. Sticky medium-full body.

On tap at Dark Lord Day 2013, served in a tasting glass. Pours deep black with a small head that fades and leaves few bubbles. The nose has huge bourbon barrel notes, along with molasses, oak, chocolate and a hint of smoke. The flavour is medium-sweet with molasses, big oaky bourbon notes, vanilla, caramel and dark chocolate. The finish is long and oaky, with molasses and a touch of hops. On the palate, it is full in body with a creamy texture and soft carbonation. Overall, wow, this is a truly awesome imperial stout with beautiful bourbon barrel notes. Definitely one I will keep an eye out for. 2013-04-27

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2014 On tap at Fischmans in Chicago, this is one special stout. Black with brown head. Aroma of chocolate and roasted malts and some bourbon. Flavor is rich and full, chocolate, bourbon, roasted malts. It has a nice sweetness. A big round flavor. Full mouthfeel. This is so nice. So easy to drink. Just slightly less complex and wonderful than The Abyss to my palate.

Edited to add: Im drinking a 2014 bottle of this now, and holy cow, I love this beer. Im not sure theres anything nicer!

12oz 2012 bottle from Capones. Black with a very slight ruby hue, no head at all. A year old, the bourbon has mellowed yet still seems fairly fresh, lots of vanilla, oak, semi-sweet malt, anise, dark chocolate, slightly burnt butterscotch. Full oily body, mild+ carbonation, slightly buttery bourbon, smooth chocolate and booze finish until you get a bit of a bite on the finish. This is a very very good beer although I prefer my bourbon less buttery (is that makes sense)...would love more though!
beige head disappears without lacing. coffee coloured. aroma of vanilla, coconut, roasted malts. taste like aroma, bitter finish. dense mouthfeel, soft carbonation.  bottle 33 cl
Bottle thanks to mikem409. Thick viscous pour with minimal head. Flavor is full of vanilla and soft oak. Thick. Viscous. Great. Booze is minimal. Alcohol is not noticeable. Grate
Chocolate, coffee, smoke, thick, black, heaven in a bottle. Had this after the Iceman cometh.
Notes from backlog. Amazing mouthfeel, great balance between complex notes of chocolate + malts and the power of the bourbon barrelling. Love it!

So this is totally awesome. Pours black with tan head. Amazing aromas of vanilla and oak, cinnamon raisin oatmeal too. Outstanding. Flavors are vanilla and dark chocolate, coconut, coffee too. Notes of dark fruit. This is an amazing beer.

12oz bottle - 

This beer reminds me in many delicious ways of Kate the Great. The body is black ink with light brown creamy head. The aroma is just crazyinsane. Vanilla syrup, figs, vinous, light alcohol, raisins, and something that reminds me of a Hot Toddy...kinda buttery/butterscotch but deeper. Flavors explode on the palate and the complexity rivals that of the best wines Ive had. Dark chocolate, mocha, vanilla, bread pudding...its almost like a bread pudding mixed with maple oatmeal mixed with bourbon then a splash of kahlua. The sweetness is there, but its reeled in and only harmonizes with the other flavors. Are more sweet, it might be a big mess. Any less sweet, and the flavors wouldnt mingle as well. A world class beer.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2014 Bottle thanks to scooch. Pours dark black with a big mocha head that sticks to the glass. Smell of oak, bourbon, chocolate, dark fruits. Just great. Taste is complex. Oak in the front. Bourbon in the back. Dark fruit. Just phenomenal.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle brought by Max, who wanted to be WinnerOfTheTasting, to Pauls when we met up at Pauls to watch some fetusballs. Pours a deep black without much of a head. Soft roast on the nose, a touch of cocoa, chocolate, warm roast and brownies. Medium-bodied, roast, cocoa, chocolate, cocoa. Long cocoa on the finish, bitter baking chocolate. Beautiful.

Wow! This beer is absolutely the best bourbon barrel aged beer I've ever had! Wish I had a case! If you haven't had this beer, you need to try it. Nose is Bourbon, coconut and chocolate. Flavor is very Bourbon forward with hints of coconut. Alcohol is hidden. Best enjoyed 50-60 degrees in a pint glass....haha just kidding, use a snifter! Bells has a home run here!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap 11 months aged. Pours dense black with a modest tan ring of bubbles. Rich aroma of roasted barley and light bourbon barrel sweetness. The flavor is rich earthy roasted grains bitter baking chocolate with a healthy dose of oak and a moderate bourbon sweetness. It starts solid with a rich sweet malt and light booze but ends grainy and dry with the bourbon lingering. Very solid all the way through.

On draft at the Eccentric Café. The pour is black, with minimal lace on the glass. The aroma is bourbon and creamy coffee on the finish. The taste is brilliant. Immediately creamy, bitter notes with vanilla taking a little dominant force and the hint of bourbon. The alcohol is magnificently hidden and this is just my favorite beer. The creamy finish and hints of vanilla and bourbon just blow me away. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is solid, a lot of licorice and sweet malt. Appearance is a deep, dark black. Taste is a perfect blend of Expedition and Double Cream, the harsh Russian mellowed by sweet cream. Amazing. Mouthfeel is a perfect thick, no booze presence. Overall, wow wow wow.

Bottle courtesy of "hannont". Colour...VERY dark brown with no head. Nose...boozy, oaky, brown sugar and savory nuts. Palate...bit of oxidation, oak stave, tannins, burnt sugar, and booze galore! The mouthfeel is thin but the flavour complexity makes up for the thin aspect.
Had this one aged 1 year courtesy of Nick. Very dark, black and less roasty than dark fruit and licorice. Minimal head.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2015 Pours black with little head. Dark fruit, dark chocolate and tobacco. Well balanced and tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Omg! No head, black as night. On tap at Deagans in Lakewood, Ohio. Tastes like its 10 yrs old. Raisins, tobacco, chocolate, alcohol, soft bourbon finish. Sipper all the way. Best stout Ive ever had. Like expedition on steroids.
Huge thanks to tectactoe. One of my biggest wants from Bells. Smells, looks, taste fantastic. Really really good stuff.

High expectations for this one! I love both the Double Cream and Expedition stouts. This beer builds on that with plums, raisins, and licorice. Roasted flavors are very clean. Would have rated higher but the bourbon flavors and aroma kinda fell out of this one. Still very nice.

Sampled at GABF 2013. Pours black with a short tan head. Aroma of dark fruit and espresso. Excellent flavor of coffee, dark chocolate, licorice, and a hint of ripe plums. Alcohol creeps up on the finish. Awesome and well worth the hype.
Sampled at GABF 2013. Black with a light tan head. Roast, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, oak, coffee. Starts out sweet and smooth with a dry, light bitter finish.
Had on draft and big beer festival. Dark black appearance with nice stout and cream mix. Hint of bourbon is smooth and this beer is excellent. KBS was slightly better, but both are amazing beers.
On draft at the GABF 2013. Pours black with a tan head. Intense dark cherry and plum flavors , with a hint of chocolate and bitter roasted notes. Lingering slightly bitter finish. Wow!

On tap at Stein and Vine. Ive been after this one for some time. Pour is jet black with a tan head that disappears rather quickly, leaving spotty
Lacing. Initial nose seems to reveal bourbon, roasted malts and a hint of tar. As it warms, the chocolate and licorice appear. Taste is amazing, bourbon, coffee, chocolate, roasted malts and licorice. Mouth feel is perfectly balanced. This beer certainly deserves its ranking!

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 12/28/2012. Pours dense pitch black color with a small tan head with decent retention, that reduces to a spotty lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, toast, vanilla, toffee, bourbon, oak, clove, raisin, licorice, light coffee, cream, light char, and roasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of roasted malt and barrel notes; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, vanilla, toast, toffee, bourbon, oak, clove, light coffee, cream, raisin, licorice, light char, and roasted earthiness. Minimal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, vanilla, toast, toffee, oak, bourbon, clove, light coffee, cream, raisin, licorice, light char, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity and balance of dark/roasted malt flavors with very balanced barrel complexity; with zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Light carbonation and full bodied; with a very creamy and slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a fantastic barrel aged imperial stout. All around fantastic complexity and balance of dark/roasted malt flavors with barrel character; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

12oz 2012 bottle.
Aroma is fairly chocolates with a nice dark chocolate note and a lighter milk chocolate one. Moderate bourbon note and a nice vanilla aroma as well. Light roast and oak.
Pours black with a small, thick mocha head that quickly recedes leaving just a film on the edges. 
Flavor is similar to the aroma. Medium sweet chocolate character with a balance of dark and milk chocolate. Medium bourbon character with a nice vanilla note. Balanced bitterness. Lingering sweetness with some moderate alcohol spice. As it warms the fruit esters become more apparent with some nice plum, prune and fig notes.
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium low carbonation. Low to no astringency with medium alcohol warmth. Slightly sticky in the finish. 
Overall a very enjoyable imperial stout with a really nice vanilla character, and it pretty much lives up to the hype. The bourbon is light and complimentary and the vanilla is surprisingly strong. Not too big and sticky with nice fruit esters as it warms.

Bottle. Thanks Hallinghansen. Pours deep black with a medium, staying, creamy, beige head. Aroma has luscious chocolate, light coffee, lots of vanilla and Bourbon. Low carbonation, fine dry and very creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has mild roasted notes, hazelnuts, vanilla, chocolate. Again kinda fat and luscious. Fairly sweet in the middle, but fine viniousness to balance. Okay malty bitter finish. Kinda chewy. Very nice and balanced.

Had at the Bells tap takeover at Yogis out of a snifter. The two guys next to us were drinking Leinenkugels Berry Weiss. I dont know what to say.

Pours a jet black with a small tan head that immediately fades away.

Smells of bourbon with a little oak and vanilla thrown into the mix.

There is a strong bourbon presence throughout the taste with vanilla and bitter roasted malts as well. Theres also a little bit of a smooth creaminess to it, Im guessing from the Double Cream Stout.

Thick and viscous mouthfeel. Lots of sludge.

Very good beer, but doesnt quite achieve Holy Grail status for me. The alcohol was not especially well hidden which I dont mind, but it knocks it down just a tick. A very good combo of two already good beers though and a very complex delightful treat.
Yeah yeah. Had this a little ways back but is definitely one of the best stouts of all time. A classic.

35,5 cl bottle vintage 2012 (11,8%) @ RIP camp, bottled 28.12.2012. Thanks tiong!
Aroma has strong bourbon notes with vanilla and some woody notes. Flavour has woody notes vanilla, lots of bourbon notes, some licorice and salty notes. Quite high on bourbon, reminds me of Brooklyn Black Ops. This is just more intensive.

355ml bottle from a trade, thanks Hugonaut13! @ RIP Camp
2012 vintage, bottled 12/28/12 - Pours pitch black with a tiny light brown head. Aroma of harsh strong bourbon notes, wood, vanilla, chocolate, roasty malts and sweet syrup. Taste is a bit harsh with loads of bourbon, sweet chocolate, syrup, roastiness, vanilla, cocoa and hints of licorice. Finish is roasty and a bit sticky with loads of bourbon, vanilla, wood and oak. Hints of vanilla, chocolate, coffee, syrup and sweetness. Quite heavy on the bourbon notes, but also very balanced and tasty, perhaps a bit sweet and sticky. Great stuff anyways.

355 ml bottle @ RIP camp.
Pours a pitch black colour with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, bourbon, wood, mild vanilla and some wood. Rich flavour of roasted malts, vanilla, harsh grains, grassy bitterness, wood, some herbal notes, weak sweetness and milk chocolate. Full bodied, oily mouthfeel and a long, warming, roasty finish with some bourbon notes and oak. Reminds me of Brooklyn Black Ops in its harshness. Not very subtle, thus a bit too aggressive. After it warms up, the harshness settles down a bit and its taken over by the sweet bourbon notes.

355 ml bottle (11,8%) @ RIP Camp. 2012 Vintage. Bottled on 28.12.2012.
Pours jet black color with a small beige head. Aroma of bourbon, faint tar notes, roasted malts, licorice, vanilla, some hops and hints of coffee, some chocolate also. Flavor of chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts, more milky chocolate and faint hops. A bit harsh malty palate with a sweet chocolaty finish, could have been a bit smoother. Excellent anyway, especially aroma-wise.
5426

Bottle: Poured a deep black color stout with a nice large dark brown color foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma consists of bourbon with some vanilla notes and black chocolates. Taste is also dominated by a well-balanced mix between some vanilla, bourbon, creamy black chocolates and light bitterness. Body is thinner then I had anticipated with good carbonation and no alcohol was apparent. Very solid barrel-aged stout but I would have loved a bit more of body to this beer.

Ahh yes.. Cracked this open for my #600th rating... 
Pour is opaque black, with a small n quickly disappearing tan light mocha - brown head. This be looking beautiful.
Aroma has plenty of bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, wood, slight leather, wood, slight banana n coconut, slight booze, oatmeal, some green notes, caramel, slight brownie fudge, slight roasted coffee beans. Yihaa, this is some tasty shit. Quite complex indeed, with everything thats supposed to be in an Impy stout. 
The taste is slightly sweet upfront, with a very well balanced roasted bitter end. Semi-full bodied, with a very pleasant semi-flat carbonation. Real smooth and slightly sticky. This is the best beer Ive had from Bells, and a huge shout-out to Jeff for sending me this. (This has an insanely long and delicious aftertaste, my kind of beer)

12oz bottle from West Lakeview at Zwanze Day 2013, 2012 vintage. Pours a jet black color with a thin tan head that quickly fades to bubbles around the edges. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, oak, chocolate, nutty, roasty. Heavy on the palate with light carbonation. Flavor is sweet, roasty, coffee, bittersweet chocolate, bourbon, oak, vanilla, a little smokey, with a bittersweet, bourbon finish. A fantastic bourbon barrel aged stout. Glad I was finally able to try this.

A deep dark stout with a thick dark brown head. In aroma, a beautiful chocolate malt with soy sauce, iodine, coffee grind, very nice. In mouth, a beautiful sweet mocha chocolate, coffee grind, alcohol warmth, rich and complex. Shared with GRM and Boutip. Merci Phil.

2012 330 ml bottle from Tommy and Polo, thanks!. Shared a while back at RBAG and I have had a few times since...beautiful oily black pour, nice caramel tanned head that rises about an inch and then drowns into the black hole of this glass of awesomeness. Rich smell of chocolate, caramel, coffee, oak, bourbon. Just extremely fucking rich with a lot going on. Taste is sweet, oaky, a very thick creamy mouth feel...feels like KBS on steroids.  The flavour lingerswhat a treat, wonderful stuff. Cheers.

(from backlog of RBAG 2013 ratings notes). Many thanks to kbudd for actually tracking me down during the fest to make sure I got some of this magnificent beast. Rich and decadent, sweet but not cloying, with toasted coconut really standing out amongst other flavours of chocolate, figs, sweet bourbon vanilla, and I even wrote "crême caramel" in the margins (not entirely sure what I was getting at there lol). Superb.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Aromas of bourbon, dark dried fruit, almond, vanilla, and alcohol. Jet black with a thin beige head. Off-dry, hot, somewhat fruity, savory, flavors of chocolate-covered black cherries, char, and alcohol. Full bodied, pretty smooth, sticky in the finish, with lingering roasty and earthy flavors.

Roasty cocoa and bourbon notes some warm vanilla and kinda coconut scents. Medium brown head and dark black body. Warm bourbon and chocolate notes some vanilla and roasty malts. Smooth but hot on the palate.
Warm, hot, salty. Flavor is not too sweet, deep, or complex. Instead it seems smoothed out and burnt out with the extra barrel aging. I would prefer the original beers separately instead.

Bottle opaque black minimal head. Nose chocolate and bourbon some molasses. Taste vanilla roast chocolate. Sweet and syrupy. Bourbon adds layers of complexity instead of overwhelming. Very smooth. Bourbon and roast aftertaste.
Bottle at my place with group. Pours black with light lacing. Aroma is thick malt vanilla spirits chocolate. Taste is cocoa, big malt. Finish is savory, and very nice smooth.
Boozy chocolate and toffee nose; roasty with more baker's chocolate on the palate. Viscous body yields a more syrupy experience than I remembered. This is a damn fine stout.

Bottle, thanks to Benzai. Black beer with a beige to light brown, medium head. Aroma of bourbon, tar/peat, roasted malts, sweet coffee and sweet alcohol. The sweetness is a bit overwhelming and comes back in the taste, where I also find the bourbon, roasted malts/coffee again. Not bad, but my expectations were a bit higher.

Wow. 2nd most favorite Bells I have tried so far. Smells very nutty with hint of molasses. Very dark with nice thick head. Taste of licorice, nut and molasses. Nice aroma of boubon oak barrel as well. Bravo!

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2015 Tap: Black as hell with a thin, deep mocha head. Aroma is huge; chocolate, roast, oak, smooth bourbon, vanilla, mild coconut, molasses, burnt brown sugar, and some sweet dark fruit. Taste is the same... So balanced; bourbon is insanely smooth and its got a perfect amount of balancing sweetness. Roast, cocoa, vanilla, molasses, oak. hint of maple syrup in there... This stuff is absolutely awesome.

Bottle thanks to hubsluvsbeer: Poured a deep black with very whispery tan head. Aroma is vanilla, chocolate, and bourbon. Wow there is so much going on in the taste, vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, and malt. Alcohol tingle in the finish.

Comes out of the tap a rich sable just a whisker above black with a dark, chocolaty tan head. Roast malt aroma has an overtone of bourbon-soaked wood and subtle notes of coffee, caramel and licorice. Flavor begins with a strong bourbon note and then blossoms with roast malt, quality coffee, semi-sweet chocolate, caramel, licorice, toffee and molasses. It is quite sweet, but not nasty; bourbon bite helps offset the sweetness. Mouthfeel is silky smooth and quite viscous, with an appreciable and persistent tingle. I have been chasing this beer for months, narrowly missing it at stores and getting no response from trade offers - and now I have finally scored this delectable brewski. Worth the wait!

Wow nice tasting beer sweet flavor. Slight barrel sour aroma. Not a lasting head. Sweet cannula cream stout taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 Note: this review was for RBSH3Ive just poured myself a beer, and a damn good beer at that. That should be enough, shouldnt it? No, Ive poured this beer into a fancy piece of glassware. Im holding that fancy glass up to the light to get a good look at its contents. Im taking note of the color, the viscosity, the way the head laces. Im smelling the beer, not taking a quick whiff, but smelling it, making sure to write down that Im picking up rich notes of bourbon, coffee, and chocolate. After a needlessly long period, I finally give my beverage a taste. One might think I can finally enjoy the blasted thing now, but I dont. I spend more time writing. I have a good beer in front of me, and Im typing words into a computer. Why am I doing that, and who am I doing it for?

On tap at Busy Bee (Raleigh). 

Pours a deep dark brown with caramel head. First scent is the cream/vanilla, followed by malt. Very nice. 

Taste is a coordination of the bitterness of the Expedition with the sweetness of the double cream. It works well to offset the sickly sweetness of the Double Cream, but still very sweet. 

I've been told it will be better warm. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours pitch black with a finger tan head. 

Smell is very rich and creamy, getting a lot of the special double cream stout. Oak and vanilla, tobacco and char, chocolate. Very much like Parabola. 

Taste is smooth cream, tobacco, leather, vanilla and oak, a bit of licorice, light red fruit. 

Very drinkable, smooth as velvet.

I think this is simply amazing.

A couple 2 ounce tasters at the 2013 Great Taste in Madison. This stuff was like bite out of a fresh German chocolate cake. The soothing character and undertow of intensity of it all made it really stand out from most of the other options at the fest, assertive yet really enjoyable. I could drink this all afternoon. Aroma was loaded with a pleasant blend of nuts, sweet chocolate, bourbon, coconut and coffee. Appearance was motor oil black, tan head, completely opaque. Taste was coffee, chocolate, vanilla, coconut, very subtle bourbon on oak, and more vanilla on dark doughy chocolate. Very smooth palate feel, heavy bodied, notably unnoticeable abv. Overall, this one lived up to my expectations and I look forward to having it again.
Very dark reddish brown. A small head. Nice roasted malts and chocolate, vanilla. The alcohol is there for sure. Expected a little more from this one. Smell is better then taste.
For his black has good brown head. Smoky. Good charcoal stout you got Alakoko coffee of vanilla notes.

Bottle [from trade with Boltz7555] shared with Dutchdrebus, Ansjelaah and Joes @ weekly tasting. Opaque pitch black color, small medium brown head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, slightly peat, roasted malts, lots of bourbon. Taste moderate to heavy malty, some hops, liquorice, alcohol, bourbon, again a touch of peat. Full body, medium carbonation.
Dankzij benzai, gedronken met benzai, dutchdrebus en joe, zwarte kleur, beige schuimkraag, ruik en smaakt bourbon, alcohol, beetje stout, smaakt lekker

Bottle @ benzai. 2012 version. Pitch black with a small light brown head. Smells bourbon, almond, hazelnut, roasty, dark chocolate, roasty, alcohol. Love it. Tastes bourbon, wood, almond, hazelnut, hint of cherry, dark chocolate, roasty. Amazing taste. Full bosy, silky, nice carbo.

This beer is exactly what I want it to be. It is a stout no doubt with the perfect addition of bourbon. Most BBA stouts are taken over by the bourbon, while this is not a terrible thing, it still takes away from the beer. The use of Expedition and Special Double Cream gives it both a smoothness in the body but a slightly bitter finish that is perfect for the style. I couldnt and wouldnt as for anything different in a bourbon barrel aged stout. At $6 a bottle it is definitely a treat but one that I would buy a 4-pack at any opportunity.

12 oz. 2012 from a trade with rxeight....thanks, Al! Deep black with thing dark head. Nose of molasses, vanilla, wet oak, bourbon, dark malts, some licorice. Oily viscous mouthfeel. Taste follows nose for the most part, but a big lingering dry middle of bakers cocoa. Finishes sweet with dark malt and vanilla. Very smooth and alcohol well hidden. Reputation is deserved-great stuff. Stood up and went well with salted dark chocolate.

[750ml bottle, courtesy of cgarvieuk] Black pour, no real head to speak of, other than a fragmentary lacing of faint bubbles. Sits there, looking highly menacing. Lovely aroma though  soft, roasty wood-laced chocolate, mocha edges and coconut. Plenty of coconut on the flavour too, with sweet vanilla and a mild background hum of bourbon. Very easy to drink. Worryingly so, in fact [21062013]

Thanks to Kevin for sharing at RBAG 2013! From 12 oz bottle into snifter. Completely black, opaque, and beige head sticks to the sides of the snifter. First smell I get is of dark dried fruits, which I find interesting since its bourbon barrel aged. Of course you get the bourbon on the nose, but also you can smell sweetness. Alcohol is also evident in the nose. Tastes of coffee, dark dried fruits, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oakiness. Very well balanced and smooth. Not harsh at all, especially for being 11.5%. Nice aftertaste of vanilla that lingers in the mouth. Mouthfeel is full-bodied, velvety smooth and lightly carbonated.

7/20/13. Given to me by my 1st trade. Thinking about it 2 days later I wish I drank it first because I drank entirely too many beers before this one and unless everyone's wrong, it wasn't memorable. 
Gave it a 3.9 based on I consider a 4 to be pretty dam good
Need a redux 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2013 750 ml bottle 875 A- thick black pour with a faint tan head and weak lacing. S- molasses is prominent, with sugary milk chocolate, toffee, bourbon, vanilla, wet pungent grains, licorice, cinnamon raisin bread, plums, pie crust and faintly musty oak. M- smooth and light body considering it is a barrel aged stout. Palate is medium and satisfying. Carbonation is underwhelming. T- molasses and grain are first, followed by the toffee and baked crust. Mineral water also mixes in. Vanilla, graham cracker, marshmallow, dry oak and caramel. The ending is a fudge and mildly tangy cacao with alcohol that sits on the palate until it fades into a bitter chocolate. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 oz bottle and draft, prefer it out of the bottle. Hands down best bba stout ive ever had. Chocolate/coffee/perfection.

Aroma of rich chocolate cake, toffee, and caramel. Pours black with a great fizzy film. Taste is wonderful with cherry cordial, toffee, and angel sperm. Taste is wonderful with cherry chocolate, oak and sweet toffee. Wonderful. Long expected.

Pours an opaque very dark brown with a quickly vanishing, short khaki-brown head. The aroma is striking. Caramel, vanilla, and coconut. The mouthfeel is thick and a bit oily with just the slightest carbonation scrub on the rear of the palate. Flavors of coconut, wood, nut, bourbon barrel vanilla, and dark, ripe fruit. This is quite reminiscent of Parabola.
Pours black with low brown head, aroma is oak and bourbon and roast with coconut.. Taste is rich sweet maltly bourbon awesomeness, very smooth finish as well!

Bottled February 28, 2012.
Appearance: The body is an opaque black with no head, only a thin tan ring with no presence of carbonation at all on the surface.
Aroma: Bourbon is on the forefront with coconut, chocolate and roasted malts backing it with a sweet creamer aroma, it reminds me of an Irish potato of sorts at times.
Taste: Coconut is heavy with a prominent creamer backing, reminding me of an Irish potato minus the cinnamon. Bourbon and chocolate is prevalent, very complex with hints of caramel also notable on the finish. Very nice.
Palate: Medium to thick with light carbonation.
Overall: This is an excellent beer, theres a lot going on and its incredibly well balanced. I would drink this often if I could.
Dark dark chocolate, leather, oldest barrels ever, prunes, its super rich and 9 grain toasted bread. Pair with a fresh fruit tart.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2013 On tap at NOC in Bryson City (NC).
Black with brown edges. The head is not durable but the ring is. 
Very, very rich aroma and flavor. Mildly sweet with fairly well hidden ABV. 
indescribably delicious. Dark infused fruit.
Very smooth feel, with a good bit of warming. 
Barrel aging is obvious; perhaps a bit too obvious.

Very kindly shared by Kermis. Poured dark and seep with a small tan head. Aroma of bourbon alcoholic sweetness, coffee grinds and dark chocolate. Full body, flavour as the aroma with caramel and molasses with soaked berries.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2014 Bottle shared thanks to trade with Kraddel. Pours black with a ring brown head. Aroma of massive bourbon, vanilla, toffee, fudge, milk chocolate, malt, oak, molasses. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light moderate bitter. Creamy and perfectly balanced, intense yet mellow, this is incredible. Full bodied with very soft carbonation.

Sample thanks to kermis. Big thanks!
Thin tan head. Clear black pour. Lovely chocolate and coffee. Some vanilla. An awesome brew.
Finally! 12 ounce thanks to Matt. Bourbon throughout. Thick in body. Sticky. Rich. Vanilla. Smooth. Little carbonation.

Bottle, thanks Mike. Black with thin tan head. Aroma of coconut and vanilla. Taste is full on coconut bourbon, some chocolate, not much else. Sweet and creamy. Bit one dimentional and pretty much all bourbon. Nice though

Fast fizzling head. No trace after 2 seconds. Aromas of tabacco, whiskey, toffee and butterscotch. Taste is whiskey forward. Almost too much as the malt bill is a little thin for the intense whiskey flavor. Other notes on the palate hint at chocolate, coffee and finishes dry on palate
Side by side with KBS. This has a lot more cheesy funk to it. Aggressively strong. Brown sugar. I am definitely more of a fan of the Founders in this tasting. Dark and fruity.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2013 Draft at Renos East. Heavy bourbon aroma with some caramel and vanilla. Extremely dark pour with thin tan head.  Extremely smooth in mouth.  Oak, bourbon, caramel, vanilla flavor.  Incredibly awesome.

12 oz bottle. Had this a few times so I thought I should rate it. poured black tan head that left some nice lacing. aroma bourbon dark fruits with cherries leading the way, chocolate,coffee, roasty, alcohol, vanilla,  cocoa. flavor just what I would expect from a good bourbon. with  chocolate, coffee, cherries plums and and other dark fruits. what was nice about this beer it was nice and smooth
Bottle 1027 of 1081. Black beer with a brownish head. Dark dried fruits, cocoa, vanilla, bourbon and malty aroma. Salty, licorice, malty, dark dried fruits, cocoa and vanilla flavour.

Awesome! Pours like motor oil, black with thin tan head. Aroma is booze bourbon vanilla and coffee notes. Drinks so smooth, creamy like. Taste is the perfect amount of bourbon, oak, chocolate, coffee, cream. Minimal carbonation but just the right amount. Top barrel aged stout.

Pours thick and super black with a small thin head. The nose is boozey, chocolate, licorice, vanilla, wood, leather and cherry. The taste is high sweet and medium heavy bitter. The texture is sticky and sharp, hot, the body is medium to heavy and finish is long. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle in a snifter.  Pours black with a lacy, tan head.  Aroma of bourbon, roasted malts, a good amount of dark chocolate, a little coffee, cream, and a little bitterness.  Flavor so strong of bourbon, cream, and the roasted malts.  Thick texture.  A great beer.

Draft at Beet & Brat festival at Crystal Mt.  Pours dark black.  Aroma of roast and bourbon.  Flavor of coffee, chocolate, and vanilla.  Big thick body.  Great thick mouth feel.  Ive been looking for this for a while and once I saw that Bells was offering it at a local beer festival I made it my first tasting of the evening.  Its a sipper of course, but a very good one.  Bells has a ton of fine beers and this is one of the best.

Drinking this beer is like the feeling of moving on to a higher plane of existence.  The aroma is rich and fudgey, full of plums and cocoa and hints of bourbon, never overbearing.  The taste is the same, on an oil slick palate that never feels burdensome.  A beer that is easy as hell to drink, that tastes like a bourbon barrel beer without tasting like bourbon, and that is a goddamn feat.  This is, without question, the finest BA stout I have ever tried.
Draught.  This is a real treat that is worth grabbing if you see it on tap or in a bottle.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2014 This is a great beer!   I have not had a stout this good in awhile, thats for sure.  I get chocolate, vanilla, brown sugar, caramel, and some coffee in the nose.  A super creamy palate finishing nice and sweet.
I love this beer.  One of my favorites.  Great flavor.  Much smoother than other BA stouts.
Another solid brew from Bells.  This is one of my favorites that they put out and a top notch BBS.  If you see it have a few since it doesnt go around often.

A - Smells of bourbon.

AP - Thick Black with an amber color

T - Taste is very well balanced with the bourbon flavors.  The blend of 2 stouts is also done amazingly well.  The cream in the double cream ale is what offsets the intense bourbon to me.

O - Hands down best BA stout Ive ever had.

Medium full body. Pours black with a deep ruby hue. Lasting tan head. Aroma is strong dark fruit, slight alcohol, chocolate. Low coffee and roasted aroma and taste for a stout. Very smooth and excellent lingering aftertaste of sweet fruit and chocolate

Tasted at TWCP Beer Fest 2013.  It poured a black color with a tan head. The aroma was of chocolate and bourbon. The taste was very smooth, almost a cream texture of bourbon, chocolate, coffee and a slight vanilla. Very well done.

Draft. Black in the glass with a creamy tan head that settled to a ring. Roasted malt and vanilla aroma.  The flavor found chocolate, roasted malt, and a backing of hops. Medium to full body with a roasted malt aftertaste.

Bouteille de 355ml version 2012 brassée le 28 décembre 2012, autant dire quelle est fraiche. Liquide brun foncé avec un filet de mousse. Un nez terreux darômes tertiaires  de sous-bois, de champignon, de chocolat, de pâte à pain pas encore cuite. En bouche cette bière est puissante, du chocolat, du bourbon, du bois, le café est absent à contrario du bois. Cette bière semble mangée par la barrique. Simple, pas le classique que je mattendais.

Had outside at the Az crews epic driveway tasting that I was so kindly invited to.  Another gem makes an appearance.  Its 95 degrees out Im sitting in direct sun and im drinking 10% imp stout and couldnt be happier.  Pours black with purplish head.  nose of huge molasses and dark chocolate.  tastes of bourbon sweetness, dark chocolate, molassess, coffee, earthy, vanilla, and every dark fruit that exists.  creamy mouthfeel and lives up to hype. kick ass
Pretty solid beer.  Pours black with thin tan head.  Chocolate and vanilla flavors with mild alcoholic burn on the back end.  Solid beer.

Bottle from International; pitch black pour with quickly disappearing head, alcohol hit in the aroma, love the slick mouthfeel,bourbon taste not overwhelming just where it should be, vanilla, dried fruit wished it was a 750 hope we meet again.

Bien heureux douvrir une bouteille de cette cuvée qui est née le 28 décembre 2012.  À 4.31 de moyenne, faut-il sattendre à une merveille?  Une fois versé, ce liquide brun ne permet quune mince construction mousseuse.  Au nez, rien comme une uvre majeure.  Je dirais même plus, que des arômes raisonnablement riches et cossus de chocolat, de caramel et de bourbon vanillé.  Sur les papilles, rien dautre quune prodigieuse et délectable épopée de malts chocolatées, de bourbon enrobant et de mélasse fruitée.  En bouche, rien comme une grosse et féroce bête visqueuse.  Je dirais même plus: un corps qui est altéré par la barrique peut parfois être agréable.  En finale, rien comme une grosse chaleur.  Je dirais même plus que la douceur des malts chocolatés se transporte vers une amertume timidement établie par des notes de café.  En résumé, rien comme une proposition messianique.   Je dirais plutôt quil sagit dune bière franchement parfumée, savoureuse à souhait et très facile à boire.  Salutations à solidfunk pour cette chose plutôt rare.

I had some mindless work to do and felt it might go better with beer.  Heard that Thinking Man Tavern in Decatur was pouring Black Note and made my way over.  Poured a deep dark brown with just a hint of red.  Tan head.  Felt just slightly oily on my tongue.  Malty with vanilla notes ad a slightly bitter finish.  The whiskey was more hidden than I expected.  Excellent beer that I will try and grab again if available at Thinking Man Tavern.  Draft - Thinking Man Tavern - Decatur, GA

Chilled brown bottle poured into a snifter, big thanks to Josh.  Pours black with small light brown head.  Medium/thick body, medium carbonation, and nice chocolate aroma.  Taste is complex sweet chocolate.  Great imperial Stout.  My favorite of 12 highly rated imperial stouts.

12-oz. Second batch, bottled 12-28-12. Thanks, JA! Pours jet black with a dense and creamy dark tan head that sticks around forever and ever. Humongous bourbony nose hits you before you really even get your nose anywhere near the mouth of the glass. Sweet and chocolatey, lots of vanilla and apricots, theres coffee and prunes as well, but the predominant quality by far is the intensity of the oak and the bourbon without a doubt. Thick creamy body, almost sludgy, still showing carb--but its kind of a formality. Even if this were re-carbed, the density of the body would still keep this moving more like a creamy liqueur. So dont spend a lot of time thinking about them bubbles. The mid-palate is big and sweet and bourbony, oaky, showing lots of vanilla and apricots and some sharper phenolic bourbony notes. Then lots of coffee, chocolate, prunes, and other stout notes thunder past. Its big, heavy, complex, harmonious, just incredibly well done throughout. Lovely beer.

12 ounce bottle poured a dark nutty brown color. It took a bit of coaxing but it held a coating of tan head. Aroma has sweet bourbon, chocolate, barrel wood, perfect oxidation, brown sugar, dark coffee, and some dark rich fruit. Absolutely wonderful with so many layers it just calls you to take another sniff. Mouth feel coats very well and it is rich and juicy with just enough carbonation to bring it all across. The flavor from both the rich malts and the barrel treatment are equally top notch and combine perfectly. Dark rich malts, sweet bourbon, hefty barrel wood, sticky molasses, coffee but with little bitterness, dark dried fruit, and a spicy hit of alcohol that is well within reason for such a big beer. Here is a case where the hype is deserved and the beer is beyond expectations!
Smells like bourbon barrel, caramel, chocolate, and black licorice. Dark and creamy, pretty smooth with a slightly boozy finish. I would love a vertical tasting.
Smells like bourbon and oak aging.  Taste is strong bourbon flavors as well as faint hints of oak.  Very sweet as well.

Bottle at home, courtesy of Matt. Thank you so much for this one!! Pour is pitch black with a small tan head. Big raisins, coconut, anise, vanilla, dark cocoa, prunes, toffee, and brown sugar in the aroma. Taste is big bourbon, anise, black licorice, raisins, plums, oak, cocoa nibs, vanilla, toasty, leathery, and nutty with some light bitterness on the finish. Thick/syrupy mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Tasty stuff.

On tap at Hagemeister Park in Green Bay for Bells tap takeover. Poured syrupy black and had nice brown head. Aroma is phenomenal, sweet chocolate/coffee scent with black licorice and leather mixed in. Has a oily rich heavy mouthfeel and goes down smooth as silk. Taste is sweet yet salty with black licorice, chocolate, coffee and anise. Finish is somewhat dry and mild aftertaste. Overall this beer is amazing. Reminds me of the first time I tasted Expedition Stout back in 2008. This beer is sweeter and has that dry finish but otherwise the same. Please try this beer if you get a chance, you wont regret it!

Bottle - 2012 vintage:  Near black in appearance, with a rich brown head that quickly fades away.  The aroma is quite impressive.  Very rich and deep with vanilla, oak, espresso, and chocolate.  Passes right on into the flavor.  The influence of the barrel aging is spot on.  Smooth and silky mouthfull.  Really really nice... one of my new favorites.  Thanks to Overml01 for the trade!

Pours black with a creamy brown head and fair lacing. Good roasted malt, licorice and woody bourbon aroma. Full body with a smooth texture. Complex sweet stout flavor with a smooth bourbon woody finish. Very well balanced. One of my all time favorites

750ml Bottle @ The Stouts Tasting Pt II. Deep brown pour with a tiny off-white head. Quite a muscular, thick-looking beer. The nose is huge vanilla and bourbon. Sugar-coated wood. Boozy adult brownie. Rich char. Unmistakable bourbon barrel. The taste is similarly out-sized, bold. Rich toffee and chocolate cake. Sticky toffee pudding. More vanilla and treacle. Thick, smooth body. Pretty effortless for 10.5%. Overall, a really nice beer. The internet seemed to give this beer a minor kicking after Bells released it in 12oz bottles. On this showing, Black Note is only deserving of praise. Great stuff.

Very complex with notes of vanilla, caramel, bourbon, raisins, and red vines.  Very smooth and creamy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From a bottle. Pours opaque almost black with minimal light brown head. Very smooth. Tastes very sweet like chocolate, caramel, raisins. Smells sweet and toasty. Medium body and low carbonation.

Bottle. Pours opaque black with just a trace of thin, fizzy tan. Aroma is bourbon, oak, roasted malts, plums, raisins, vanilla, floral hops, and light chocolate. Flavor is sweet and roast malts forward with supporting bourbon, oak, dark fruit esters, and light floral hops; dry, lightly sweet finish. Medium/full body and low carbonation.

Bottle consumed at THE stouts tasting part 2, thanks to Bruce. It pours near black with a small light tan head. The nose is chocolate, gateaux, dark fruit, vanilla, toasted coconut, bourbon and sweet coffee. The taste is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, toast, bourbon, light warming alcohol, mild acidity, some bitterness, earth and baking chocolate with a bitter, ashy finish. Full body, fine carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Very smooth, well-balanced and surprisingly drinkable. Good stuff.

Pas mal excité de finalement gouté à cet assemblage qui fait saliver. Arome et corpulence à la hauteur des attentes, le corps de la double cream et larome de la bcbs. Au niveau des saveurs cest très chocolaté, vanillé mais je manque la complexité unique de la expedition stout, très bien arrondie par le vieillissement...me rappelle la peruvian morning de Central waters.

12 FL OZ bottle shared with Shawn at his Somerville flat. Thanks, man. Picked from the "goofball cellar". I cant be certain, but I believe it was a 2012. Hmmm... this may be indeed overhyped.Perhaps this was a bogus year, as often are: it could have been a bad bottle; infected, maybe? Regardless, it just wasnt very good. Considerably too malty, roasted, and ashy. Booze was very prominent, perhaps too much so. Couldnt finish. I couldnt wait to try the next beer.

Had this at the source. Appearance is opaque black, light brown head. Nose of vanilla, roasted malts, some coffee and sweet chocolate. Tasted sweet and smooth with a touch of bitter. Fantastic stuff, wish I couldve grabbed some to go.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: black beer, with small beige head.
Nose: very nice balance between vanilla and chocolate, some alcohol noticeable.
Taste: bourbon all around! roasted malts, chocolate, nice amount of alcohol. 

Amazing beer!

By far one of my favorite beers of 2013.  Not super impressed fresh out of the tap, but once this beer got to about 10 degrees below room temperature it really opened up and exploded with an unbelievable flavor.

Deep dark black. Small dark brown head with some retention. Aroma is chocolate, bourbon, smokey, roasty, woody, dark fruit - all of which blend together beautifully. Full body. Magical finish that grows in chocolatey-ness. Such development; bourbon forward then roasty then chocolate. Everything flows together so well.

Aroma is toasty, sweet alcohol, dark dried fruit.  As you swallow the beer, its as if a sweet choolately silk sweet is moving down your throat.  Chocolate, roasted malt, sweet fruit and slight slight alcohol.

19th March 2013Stouts and Porters II. Thanks to Bruce for this whale. Opaque dark brown beer, short lived tan head. Palate is slightly viscous and smooth with fine minerally carbonation. Rich dark chocolate and a little aniseed. Super light coffee, but this beer really is about the dark chocolate. Finishes smooth. Pretty good, light on its toes.

Backlog. Ive had at least 12 glasses of this on tap at the brewery or other local bars. I have to confess that I have a love affair with Black Note.

Vanilla and Bourbon are so smooth on the palate. The finish stays for minutes after each sip. 

Black Note is in my top 10 all-time favorite beers.

[Bottle, thanks Guerde!] Pours black with a small head which fades very quickly. Aroma is big on bourbon, with chocolate, slight peppery notes, a little alcohol, and a spike of vanilla after warming.  Really get some blasts of chocolate after awhile.  Taste is very sweet with a lot of bourbon, alcohol builds with warming, and chocolate takes over towards the end. Good mouthfeel, but actually not quite as thick as I was expecting. Overall, an excellent imperial stout, as expected. I do prefer regular Expedition though. Thanks again, Andy, for sharing one of the last whales Ive really been actively trying to find the past couple of years!

pours oily. light head fades fast
smell is all vanilla and chocolate. vanilla dominates
very decadent. like velvet chocolate cake. lots of vanilla, toffee and caramel. loads of vanilla I cant even begin. bakers chocolate and some sweetness at the finish

One of the best, so I figured it would be a good place to start for my first rating! 

Had this one on tap at ORourkes in South Bend,IN...part of the Oberon kick-off celebration.

Aroma: Bourbon up front, but hints of dark chocolates, roasted malts and subtle vanilla.

Appearance: Pitch black, thin head of mocha foam...little lacing. A swirl of a half-full glass will give a nice oily coating.

Taste: Extremely balanced beer. Bourbon and licorice up front with roasted malt,  chocolate and a creamy vanilla over the middle and a warming finish containing notes of coffee. The bourbon and licorice calm a bit after it warms, only giving it more balance. You start to get the bourbon being more pronounced in the finish, very warm!

Palate: Full-bodied beer. Creamy. Low-Carbonation. Resonates on your palate. A true sipper.

Overall: Excellence. My favorite beer. I wish all beers had this much flavor and balance!

Vintage 2012, 12 oz. bottle into a tulip glass. Batch #11620, bottled 12/28/2012. Thanks to ObiWanKushnobi for this long time want!

A - Pours a pitch black body with two fingers worth of mocha foam. Settles out into a thin cap. Moderate lacing and retention. 

S - Starts off with the bourbon...oak, vanilla, and some char. Then some roasted malts and sweet cocoa powder. A touch of dark fruits too. No element really dominates here, just well integration of two base beers + a barrel.

T - Just all kinds of balance going on here. Smooth vanilla and oak, a bit of a bourbon butterscotch, lightly bitter coffee beans, and dry cocoa powder. A little bit of everything here. Finishes with a real faint but pleasant alcohol warmth.

M - Creamy, smooth, and decadent....thank you Double Cream stout! Surprisingly high drinkability compared to other BA stouts.

O - Perhaps the most balanced and easy drinking BA stout I have ever had. This is a damn impressive beer and I wish I somehow had year round access to this. Forever ISO, but I still prefer BCBS for its unrelenting bourbon element.

(2012 vintage; 35 cl bottle courtesy of Steasy66 my beer saint; huge thanks)

Pours black with medium, toffee head. Decent retention, nice lace and decent regeneration. Aroma is a pleasant and complex roasted malt with well integrated notes of oak, bourbon and vanilla.
