Alcohol is completely masked. Soft carbonation, full bodied without being too filling. Velvety texture and a sweet finish with coffee notes that is incredibly smooth despite the high abv. Taste is pleasantly sweet without being too cloying. Bitterness and roastedness play second fiddle to the aromatic sweetness in this one. Girlfriend says: "Its sweet and very drinkable."

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2014 Bottle thanks to mikem409 and on tap at Riverview. Poured pitch black into snifter. Minimal light tan head. Complex choco-bourbon aroma. Bourbon very evident with coffee choc. Bravo

Draft at Crunchys (from backlog).  Big vanilla and bourbon aromas.  Pours jet black with a tiny, dark tan head.  Vanilla, chocolate, coffee, cream, and bourbon flavors.  Extremely smooth mouthfeel with a thick body.

Pours a deep burnt umber color with a finger of khaki foam. On the nose there is a definite bourbon presence along with deep roasty earthy chocolate, creamy caramel and a touch of dark fruit. The palate follows the nose nicely with smooth creamy boozy deep dark chocolate notes, rotten plum, vanilla bean, and even a touch of coconut. Great balance and drink-ability. Yum !

12oz bottled December 28, 2012.  Served at cellar temperature.  Always been a huge fan of Expedition and this is one Ive sought for many years, excited to have a chance to try it (and thanks to Bells for the 12oz package and distribution!)

Pours black with a two finger brown head that settles to a light swirly creamy cap and foamy ring, leaves short-lived lacing behind.

Aroma is a big blast of bourbon, rich dark chocolate, oak, vanilla, coffee, a bit of anise, hint of smoke.  Good to very good strength.

Flavor is rich and delicious.  Quite bourbon-forward, a lot of vanilla and serious chocolate, marshmallow, roasted malts, anise, some dark fruit, little caramel, rather sweet, minimal bitterness, decent alcohol bite, but fits for the style/size.  Really good!

Mouthfeel is full bodied, very creamy, smooth, sticky, low to moderate carbonation.

Fantastic beer.  Right up there with the big boys in the style.  A real treat and worth seeking out.
Black color with tan lacing. Raisen and dark fruit aroma. Thick dark red fruity body. Big, bold, nice.

Bottle: 2012 edition 11.8% ABV
Pours black, with a small, dark brown ring.
Aroma is dark fruit, roast, chocolate, bourbon.
Flavor is sweetly, darkly fruited, malt, coffee-chocolate.
Very noticeable bourbon/oak flavours.
Sweetness morphs to a slightly sour bitterness towards the finish...as more of the barrel manifests itself...very nice, but would be better with some age behind it.

Received a few 2012 12oz bottles in a recent trade with krl2112.... Big thanks Kurt!!

Poured into my HotD goblet... short lasting dark brown head with a thick glass coating black brew...no real lacing.. retention is pretty sad.

Huge bourbon and dark fruits... cherries and raisins... vanilla and fudgy coffee spiked brownies... very rich... a bit hot, still little cold and the EtOH is warm.

Great mix of bourbon, molasses, tons of bittersweet chocolate... some cold brewed coffee for good measure.. again the alcohol is pretty hot... lingering bourbon/vanilla and brownie sundae on the finish... just lingers forever.. pretty damn well done. Happy that this one isnt overly sweet and an insulin shot isnt needed like BT.

Light carbonation with a silky thick mouthfeel.

Wish I had more of these. I opened up a 2011 750 last weekend and it was heads and shoulders better... but I just think this brew needs time to meld.

Incredibly good stout. Very thick in mouthfeel. Roasty upfront, giving way to lingering coffee notes. Deep black pour. Definitely one of the better stouts I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle, 28 December 2012 awesome chocolate smell, tons of roasted malt and sweetness, the blend of expedition and double cream is wonderful, not as thick and chewy as double cream but still as sweet, this is a great beer.
Tap. Black with one finger tan head. Huge flavor. Light bourbon and chocolate. Somehow its smooth despite the ABV. Ive definitely never had a better stout than this one.

bottle 669 of 1081
epic thnx to nbuttler, never thought id get to try this. its relesed again, so its  easier now, but this is the firsdt batch, so still remains very rare ! 
you realy deserved the extra i gave ya dude !
pours pure, oily black. very small to no foam. bourbon in the taste , but not to much ( like the bourbion in grey monday ) . very soft carbo, thcik,; buttery, sweet, bourbon, extremely balanced. waaw. this IS a top 50 beer, yet i would not ssay 9 personaly. realy , realy good though ! 

epic share by Nbutler !

Bottle 2012. Syrupy cane sugar, boozy bourbon, and prune aroma. Black with a minimal head. Sweet bourbon, dark fruit, wood, and vanilla flavor with a bitter alcohol finish.  Full body with an alcohol burn. A bit rough. Id like to try it again after a year or two of aging. For me, it didnt live up to the hype.

Bottle.  Dark chocolate malt, prune, and bourbon aroma.  Black with no head.  Sweet chocolate raisin malt and moderately bitter herbal and alcohol flavor.   Very nice malty aftertaste.   A bit rough - still nice beer though.
Black with a luscious tan creamy head. Nose is complex. Nuts, breads, toffee, honey, caramel, bourbon vanilla, chocolate. Flavor matches. Rich silky mouthfeel. Some alcohol in the finish.

12oz bottle scored via trade with Suchy.  Pours a viscous, opaque black with some creamy, beige head.  Nose is great, malt, licorice, chocolate milk, vanilla, brown sugar, cookie dough, toasted wood, light coconut.  Flavor is like a creamy, boozy mocha, chocolate, malt, caramel.  Nothing too sweet, just all very well blended.  The best part is the creamy, lucious finish.  You could drink this for days.  Superb.

Sample pour at Hunahpus. Pours deep dark black with thin khaki head. Nose is booze and more booze, dark chocolate and sweet malts. Heavy. Flavor is more booze, bourbon, sweet malt and honey. Dark chocolate and mild sweet coffee. Heavy and rich, full body like motor oil. Damn...

2012 bottle from Suchy3 as possibly the best extra ever! Poured into a snifter. Pours viscous black with a very slight brown head that quickly fades to a razor-thin halo. Light tan lacing. Big bourbon, chocolate, and coffee aroma. Taste is big on the bourbon. Lots of chocolate, vanilla, dry roasted oak with a super creamy, velvet mouthfeel. Beautiful.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle of the 2012 edition via trade with joromiller.  Thanks JR!  It pours pitch black with a thin, short lived, tan head.  The nose is big and boozy with tons of vinous, roasted malt notes, raisin, and light bourbon.  The flavor is just as big with heavy bourbon soaked raisin notes, earth, flint, oak, slight vanilla, and a little mocha.  It has the roasted notes of expedition with the creaminess of the double cream stout.  Full bodied with low carbonation leading to a lingering finish.  A touch hot due to the alcohol, this one is a sipper.
Very good. A little lacking in the palate department. Lighter than expected. Taste is decently bourbon, not overly so.
Happy birthday to me!  Thanks Karl!  Chocolate and bourbon notes all through this beer.  Awesome!

Bottle @ home ... gift from Hallinghansen Thanks my friend! .... It pours very dark brown with a medium tan head....The aroma is very nice! bourbon, molasses, wood, vanilla and ripe dark fruit...The flavor is fantastic! bourbon, caramel, vanilla, dark fruits and chocolate.... This one is just amazing!....

Bottle pours black with thin tan ring.  Aroma bourbon and oak.  Taste sweet roast malts with slight chorale and coffee, with bourbon and oak.  Finish bourbon and oak.  Palate creamy and almost thin but overall OK with an alcohol burn.
A very straightforward bourbon barrel stout but done well.  Easier drinking than many of the genre.

12oz bottles, 3 samples over the weekend .. . jet black .. . deep coffee and cooking chocolate notes, mild barrel .. . slick mouth .. . really liking this beer! its legit ... . . they pit him against his brother nibbles!

Appearance: Pours a motor oil; settles in glass with a barrel-beige head and espresso body.

Smell: Bourbon and raising swirling with melted chocolate.

Mouth/Palate: Chewy chocolate cake with slight carbonation that diffuses across palate, leaving a clean, crisp, and dry taste and the suggestion that this isnt a very syrupy beer.

Taste: Chocolate, cherry, and a subtle espresso note hide the booziness. So, too, does the carbonation.

Im not a "sugary" bourbon barrel-aged stout fan.  This reminds me of Bourbon County Stout (Goose Island in case I got the name wrong), but with far less-cloying sweetness.  Its decent, coming from a dude whos not a fan of the style.  I had to try it, though, because it was from Bells.
Screw you, this is opaque. Warming whiskey settles pleasantly into sugary cocoa and coffee laced with licorice. Really good at room temp.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2013 Little to no carbonation. Pours black with a very thin tan head. Nose is full of chocolate and bourbon. The taste is very smooth, almost a cream texture. A very good blend. Taste is of bourbon, chocolate, coffee and a slight vanilla. Very well done.

A softened Bourbon boom on the nose.  (on tap/from notes)  A bit bit bit too creamy sweet, esp. for the style, though not cloying - indeed, their is not much of a burn, but plenty of bourbon flavor on the palate.  Overall, I cant tell you what its missing.  Dangerously close to "it cant get any better"... but I, for one, wish they just barreled the expedition.  That being said, I greatly appreciate that there is a brewery out there doing a beer like this, and were lucky its Bells.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 There is very minor carbonation in my glass. The color is pure black and there is a beauty to it. An aroma fills my nose with sweet bourbon, coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla, and oak. The taste is impressive. I get a smooth cream like texture. In the flavor I taste all that I received from the aroma. The beverage is not bitter but has a slight dry finish. The finish also leaves a warming feel and does not impact the palate much. Overall this is a fantastic creation.
*Update. Aging the blacknote 2yrs has changed it minimally but what stands out the most for me is the finish. It has become slightly more bitter than I remember and it the dryness has increased. The blacknote is still a hell of a brew and Im glad I saved a bottle to age.

Bottled 12/28/12. Appearance: dark this is black with very minimal tan head. Aroma: huge delicious dark chocolate fudge brownie and vanilla and that's about it. Taste: bitter dark chocolate, vanilla, some bourbon but not "hot", some dark fruits, some coffee. So amazing!  Mouthfeel: viscous, creamy thick with little carbonation. Overall:  this is the best stout I've had to date. It is so good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle [12oz] shared with HogTownHarry & biegaman -- c/o SolidFunk. Pours a brown-purple, almost black, with a small diminishing frothy light-brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, maple syrup, coffee, chocolate, wood and vanilla -- quite nice. Flavour: Wow, now thats barrel-aging done right! Roasted malt, vanilla, chocolate, dark fruit, maple syrup, wood, red wine and more -- its complex and delicious. Theres alcohol there but not 11.9%. Medium bodied. Creamy mouthfeel. A fantastic Stout!

Execellent Beer. Poured black with a creamy tan head. Aroma and flavor were sweet malt, hints of chocolate and coffee, some licorice, quite a bit of dark fruit esters -- all rounded out with some serious bourbon barrelling. One of the best things is the creamy mouthfeel paired with the thick, vinous palate.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2013 Bottle at RBWG. Pours thick black with a fine, beige cream head. Bit of sugary chocolate in the nose, chalky roast. Big sweet flavor, marshmallow, good roast, rich chocolate, bit of burnt wood. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Warm finish, plenty of sticky sugars, dark sugars, brown sugar, molasses, light roast, mellow char, hints of toffee. Pretty heavy duty stuff, but not out of balance. Damn rich and very tasty. (4.3)Bottle shared at Bruces, London - big thanks to Bruce! Pours clear, brown-black with a fine, tan cream head. Big, rounded nose, tons of sugary, ripe dark fruits, some sugary chocolate. Big sweet flavor, mellow roast, some dark cherries, brownies, cake, hints of alcohol. Full bodied with fine, creamy carbonation. Modest warmth to finish, more dark berries, rich and sugary chocolate, some earthy bitterness, bittersweet cocoa. Lovely. (4.4)

750ml bottle via trade (#1014, batch 10136). Pours a near black with a small creamy tan head. Aroma of bourbon, oak, dark chocolate, roasted malt, coconut and vanilla. Flavor is boozy bourbon and alcohol with lots of bitter-sweet chocolate, dark roasted coffee, ash and oak. Full body with a velvety smooth mouth feel. This is an outstanding beer, awesome body, mouth feel, and aroma, there is lots of booziness but its balanced out with the rich chocolate malt.

Pours a dark thin looking brown. Heavy notes of coffee, soy and bourbon. A little lacking in carbonation. well made, but not as exciting as Id anticipated. The aroma is amazing, but I tasted an off flavor in the finish. As the beer warms more alcohol shines through in the finish. 12 oz bottle

On tap for the Bells beer dinner at Grange in Ann Arbor.  Black without much of a head.  Aroma is a strong mix of molasses, bourbon, cocoa, and dark fruit.  Delicious flavor mixing bourbon, dark fruit, molasses, soy, and cocoa, with a roasty touch.  Really quite awesome and a great surprise for the dinner.

Draft.  Poured black with a creamy tan head.  Aroma and flavor were sweet malt, hints of chocolate and coffee, some licorice, quite a bit of dark fruit esters -- all rounded out with some serious bourbon barrelling.  One of the best things is the creamy mouthfeel paired with the thick, vinous palate.

On tap at kellerhers in Peoria, IL. Pours pitch black. Nice lacy tan head. I get coffee and just dark malts on he nose. I love how hoppy this is. It starts as a really immensely dark fruity almost too sweet and creamy stout then immediately gets cut by intense hops and ends just perfect. Creamy and awesome mouthfeel. Full!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours near black with a khaki head.  Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, roast, and wood.  Taste is sweet with alcohol burn.  Good, but not as much as I remember from the first time I had it.

Black pour, thin brown lacing. Very sweet and sticky bourbon aroma. Fig, plum, cherry, blackcurrant fruits compete with milk chocolate, roasted malt, charred wood. Smooth, creamy, full-bodied, and a light bitter finish. Alcohol is decently hidden.

12 oz bottle courtesy of Mikem409. Thanks. Pours an opaque black color with a small tan head that fades to a coarse ring. The aroma is big and bold with  overpowering whiskey, anise, and dark fruits. The flavor, like the nose, features anise, raisins, dates, plums, whiskey, mocha, roasted grains and molasses. The palate is thick and chewy with soft carbonation. Finishes long and semi-sweet with lingering bourbon. Overall: very tasty, very complex--worthy of the accolades it has received.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2013 Pours a inky black with a minimal head. Aromas of soy sauce, salty water, brine. Taste is a complete 180 from the nose... Smooth restrained bourbon character, very barrel-centric, but not boozy on the palate. Very nice. Very drinkable. Alcohol is well hidden. Pretty creamy too. Nice chocolate character, along with a dose of roasted coffee. This is very good, but nowhere near the top impy stouts that Ive had, in my opinion. 

MORNING AFTER UPDATE:  So, I got so hammered last night I actually ended up puking this beer back up. It wasnt as good the 2nd time around. Poured dark brown into the sink. Aromas of harsh acid, some roast still apparent. Little to no head, even with the aggressive pour. Taste was very acidic with hints of Andy Capps Hot Fries. Hot and harsh. Finishes with an alcoholic burn and lots of shame. Lots of tooth enamel was lost, my brothers. 
2/3/1/1/1= 0.8

Funny, Ive been chasing this wale for five years and I spear it at work. The nose kind of sucks. Muted bourbon, soy, and chocolate. The flavor though is unreal. Big, boozy chocolate bomb. Obvious expo notes. Plenty of Bourbon goodness. rich. Big. Holy fuck. This is just wonderful. Completely contrasting aroma and flavor.

After a few close calls, I finally snagged this one. On tap at El Bait Shop. Color: notes of blackness. What a surprise, this is awesome. Tons of dark chocolate, roastier than all hell. Aroma is just average; theres some boozy fruityness (cherry) that I dont like.

Dark black pour, frothy tan head that recedes to a ring. Aroma of chocolate, bourbon, wood, and soy sauce. Nice viscous mouth feel, medium to heavy body. Taste is chocolate, charr, soy sauce, wood, and a nice balance of bourbon flavor.

12 oz bottle poured into a snifter. Dark brown, almost black, with a creamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, oak, and bourbon. Taste is sweet and slightly bitter. Creamy mouthfeel, very smooth. This is a great beer. I still think Bourbon County is better, but very good.
12 ounce bottle.  Thanks Mike!  Pours black with a minimal reddish brown head.  Aroma of bourbon, chocolate, wood, and vanilla.  Taste is bourbon, oak, chocolate, caramel, and vanilla.  Amazing!
Pours a dark black color with light brown head, aroma of bourbon, smooth mouthfeel with a bourbon taste and a sweet finish, awesome

12 oz 2012 bottle thanks to polomagnifico.  Dark black pour, with a bubbly tan head.  Pretty heavily roasted malt, sweetness, creamy milk chocolate, booze, and really nice bourbon vanillaey flavor.  The barrel character is really nice and smooth with warming finish.  Creamy smooth vanilla oak whiskey mmmm.

12oz bottle c/o SolidFunk (you shouldnt have!) shared with blankboy and biegaman.  2012 Black pour, solid light brown creamy/bubbly head.  Love that aroma - Treacle, herbal bitterness, red wine, figs, coffee, vanilla, alcohol - lovely, and subtle.  Taste follows - more vinous tannins - screw dat, just frickin good!   slick, average body, modest carbonation, fruity, sweet, big but not boozy, slides down way, waaaay too easily.   Sooper!

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2014 2012: 2 months after bottling. From the bottle to a snifter. Definitely bourbon. Thats all I really get in the nose. Interested to see what its like in a year. Light brown head that quickly dissipates. Front end of the taste is bourbon, back end you taste/smell the cream and malts, chocolate, coffee. The mouth feel is perfectly smooth. This is how a beer should feel.

Trade from Sean9689, thanks buddy. Very dark brown body with a medium light brown head. Aroma is bourbon, molasses, milk chocolate, wood, vanilla, malt, ripe fruit. Flavour is bourbon, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, ripe fruit, wood, malt. The alcohol tickles on the lips. Complex. This is amazing. Thanks Sean.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into a goblet. Holy Shit, that was the coolest pour ever. Formed about 1/2 a finger of thick straight up brown head. The last few drops out of the bottle beaded up like water on a skillet. For a split second there was tiny black beer marbles rolling across the head. I couldnt believe my eyes, but Im not the only one who saw it. It smells like oak and nuts. The taste is alcohol, smooth vanilla burbon flavor, and a dark chocolate after taste. The palate, is smooth and velvety. It leaves your mouth with a long after taste, and I can feel the alcohol on my lips. Dope brew.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2013 Pours a very thick, black color, very similar to Dale Coopers dream coffee in Twin Peaks. About a 1/2 finger of head. First thing you smell is bourbon. It hits you quick and than follows with a mixture of chocolate, vanilla and caramel. The flavor is almost a carbon copy of the aroma, except in reverse order. You get a littlw sweet at first, followed by a lasting boozy, bourbon flavor. This being my first BA stout, I was not expecting the booziness that came with it, but it was delicious. Bought 2 bottles, 1 for drinking and for aging. I will be looking forward to next years release.

Aroma was mostly alcohol for me, which isnt really my taste. It was a pitch black pour, with a 1-finger head. Nothing I wasnt expecting. The taste was far less alcohol than I was expecting, following the aroma, but the alcohol was a little strong on the backend. It was good, but not really for me.

Bottle from the box from mikem409 that continues to melt my feeble brain. Pours jet black with minimal tan head. Nose with notes of bourbon and oak. Body is solid, creamy, and not overly boozy. Bourbon is center stage with notes of chocolate, oak, vanilla, and roast. This is outstanding and now a permanent want. Fuck the BCBS.

Pours jet black with a thick mocha head, very thick. Aroma of chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak and caramel. Taste is sweet chocolate  and bourbon, creamy and slightly boozy. Really tasty, flavors intensify as it warms. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle brought by Perry from the source, obtained by and shared with ck1, thanks bro! Pours a cola black/brown with little head. Aroma is initially all whiskey, then as it warms, chocolate, licorice, caramel ... and vanilla. And thru the glass some brown sugar. Taste is of super smooth vanilla/chocolate with a whiskey presence. Vanilla, some caramel. Really nice layering and - interestingly only occasionally alcohol presence detected. Finishes long and smoothly sweet and slightly alcoholly. Easy to see why this is rated in dark lords league. Every bit what I was hoping for.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle thanks to unclerudy. Thanks a ton! Pours a viscous dark brown to black with a dark brown ring of roam. Aroma is heavy on caramel, oak, plum, dark roasty malts. Reminds me of a grilled bit of plum. The barrel really shines in this beer, bringing the beer up to a whole new level of awesomeness. Delicious. Thats true beat way to describe this beer.

2012 vintage bottle pour.  Phenomenal beer. Little to no head.  Aromas are strong bourbon and roasted malt goodness. Carbonation level was the only small knock I can to keep this from a perfect 5.0 in my opinion.  Seemed a bit hot on the carbonation, but overall this will go on my mantle of Top 20 beers Ive ever had (still have to decide what itll knock off though...)

12oz bottle, pours dark black with a thin tan head.  The aroma is pretty fantastic, picking up some bourbon and chocolate.  Taste is also pretty amazing, milk chocolate, vanilla, slight bourbon, very smooth.  Savored every sip of this one.  Great brew.

Bottle of the 2011. Solid black with a good beige head that leaves some nice lacing. Aroma is liquorice, soy sauce, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon. Oily mouthfeel, malty and complex on the palate with a dark chocolate and slightly boozy finish. Taste is dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, raisins, hint of coffee. Amazing.

Quite possibly one of the best beers I've ever had. In my life. No joke. 

Smooth, deep hints of bourbon, and was just as fantastic chilled at the beginning to the last lukewarm swig at the end. From my understanding, it's super rare, which makes me sad.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The black note pours so dark and thick. I was overflowing with anticipation watching the bar tender pour the beer. Has a small dark head that leaves good lacing on the snifter. The flavor is so full and features plenty of wonderful chocolate malts. I can't really find any flaws in the beer. Perhaps that the alcohol comes through in the aftertaste. But is that really a bad thing?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black with a thin dark brown head. Sweet vanilla oaky nose. Huge boozy malty vanilla bourbon bomb. Sweet, smooth, with a bit of a dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 oz Bottle. Pretty damn wonderful. Sweet aroma with just a hint of the Bourbon Barrel aging really doesnt overpower the beer and gives it tremendous balance. This is awesome.

Not your typical beer! Fantastic flavor,  doesnt taste like it smells due to burbon aging. Low carbonation but after a year in a barrel Im not surprised. Color is off for me, but taste is also good!!! Licorice, vanilla,  and a smidge of red wine... I want more

poured into a 120z tulip glass to a opaque black.liquid with a thin brown head that quickly dissipates and minimal lacing. aromas  of bourbon, chocolate, coffee and vanilla the flavor completely matches the aroma.when you smell this, you know what your about ready to taste, a beer with  strong bourbon taste.  it has a little too much alc on the finish

Bottle from a PUB"R anonymous crack whore (under contract).  Pours thick oily jet black into my Stone RIS snifter with 1-finger tan head.  The head is loud, and says to me, "How the hell did you find this beer in PA, you jerkoff?"  A good question, head.  Nose is huge and intense and complex; prunes, oaky bourbon, blackstrap molasses, blackberry, port, backup hops, and cognac.  Tastes rich, complex, hefty on the palate, with the oaky and bourbon/cognac flavor taking the forefront.  The palate heft is decreased, as we have seen with BA beers, and I dare say takes something away from this one, as it doesnt have that heavy smooth semi-sweet creaminess of the Expedition or the DC stout.  I put this one in the same genre as the 50/50 beers.  A very good beer, with the oak and spirits taking center stage.  In this case, those elements render the original beers unrecognizable for the most part, as such.  The finish gets more hoppy and charred dark malt, and a lot of scotch flavor arises, with the peaty elements coming through.  This one is a wonderful beer/spirit boundary breaker, but the 50/50s do it  too, and the Bells original beers are better.  Try this in a SBS with the 50/50 Periwinkle Blue wax, and I dare say theyd have 95% homology.

Pours as dark as motor oil with a thin off white head. Smells of bourbon are much more subtle than expected and very refined. Hints of malt and chocolate in the aroma as well. Taste is out of this world. Perfect balance on the palate of bourbon, chocolate and malt flavors. One of the very best beers Ive had!

12oz bottle poured into glass. Wow! Decided to get greedy and bust open a bottle all for myself. Super dark with a thin beige head. Aroma definitely has hints of bourbon, vanilla cream and chocolate. Flavor may be a tad boozy but it doesnt really take away from the experience. Quite outstanding and supremely delicious!
Opaque black with thin brown head. Strong sweet milk chocolate aroma.Full-bodied, sweet, creamy, dark chocolate, roasted finish. Medium carbonation. Very, very good.

On tap! Awesome nose of bourbon vanilla wood, roasty dark chocolate, notes of coffee. Pitch black color. Good thin brown head, minimal amount remains. Little lace. Big body. Dry finish. Light, softer, smoother carbonation. Awesome long vanilla roasty dark chocolate light coffee bourbon-soaked wood aftertaste. Moderate bitter taste, lighter sweet, light alcohol warmth, very tasty. Very satisfying bourbon barrel aged imperial stout.
12 oz bottle pours a black color with a nice tan head.  Aromas of dark roasted malt, caramel, chocolate.  Full bodied, incredibly balanced, incredible, one of the best beers I have had

Pours jet black with a minimal tan head.  Had aromas of chocolate and bourbon, with a bit of a roastyness to it.  Heavily sweet, and a bit of a burn from the bourbon that leaves a strong aftertaste.  Full bodied beer, and much like I would imagine drinking motor oil would feel like.  While this may be just a bit overrated, It was a pure pleasure to drink.  I have a bottle of this to age, and I am very interested to see what comes of that.

Even as a diehard Hopslam fan, this may be the best beer I've EVER had from Bell's. Thick pour, sexy black coloring, notes of dark roasted malt in the aroma, and perfect balance of sweet, roasted nuts, chocolate and caramel in the taste. BEAUTIFUL beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Bells 1/26/13. Great beer! A touch thin, but tons of vanilla caramel and coffee. A wonderful combination of their expedition and double cream stout with just the right amount of barrel overtones. I really enjoyed it!

12 oz bottle. Black, fluffy beige head that dissipates. Nose is chocolate, dark fruits, raisins, port, booze. Taste is gourmet chocolate, dried dark fruits, figs, bourbon, earth. Really dry finish that leaves a pleasant cotton mouth akin to when you quickly eat a banana. Lingering light chocolate taste. Velvety mouthfeel. Wow, I expected greatness but this even exceeded my high expectations. I think the relatively low abv for a barrel aged stout really helps the complexity of this beer shine through.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2014 Bottle, bottled less than a month ago.  Feel very fortunate to nab one of these from the store.  Pours pitch black in color with almost no head.  Surprisingly not much lacing on the glass.  Aroma is dominated by bourbon but there are hints of vanilla and smoke.  Taste is slightly more balanced than the aroma.  Lots of vanilla and oak wood to balance a bit with the bourbon but the bourbon still overpowers some.  Finish is silky smooth with a nice booziness right at end.  Mouthfeel is a little thin but I like it here.  Overall, this is really good but Im a bit disappointed.  This lacks some complexity and I would prefer the bourbon to be a bit more subtle.  I cant taste the actual beer, all I get is bourbon and barrel notes.  Its the same way I feel about BCS.  I may have built myself up too much considering its ranked #10 overall beer in the world on this site.

Re-rate 5/3/14 - Fresh 2014 bottle.  Pours jet black with a very small thin ring of head.  Aroma is a nice mix of dark chocolate, bourbon, and dark fruit.  Taste is silky smooth bourbon with dark chocolate, tobacco, caramel, vanilla, and oak.  Love the mouthfeel.  Thick and full, silky smooth, and it goes down way too easy.  I enjoyed this more than 2014 KBS.

Poured into 12oz stout glass. Smells of Bourbon, Barrel, and some prevalent vanilla notes. Very silky and smooth not much by the way of bitterness, but very well balanced. I compared this against Bourbon County and felt that it was smoother but not quite as boozy. I would say BC is better but this is extremly good and well worth the hype.

Poured from 75oml bottle.  Bottle No. 978 of 1081 from Batch 10136.  Pours nearly black with just a whisp of tan head.  Aroma is smoke, bourbon, chocolate and a bit of dried fruits.  Taste follows pretty closely.  There is a touch of stale coffee in the back end of the flavor.    I was expecting a bit more sweetness, but it is pretty well balanced really.

Bottle 1291/1524, batch 11620. Pours dark brown/black, with a brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, bourbon, dark fruit, vanilla, molasses, raisins, and some smoke. Cant sense any alcohol in the nose. Flavor is bourbon, vanilla, roasted malt, molasses, dark fruit, and just a touch of alcohol. Medium to heavy, creamy body. Glad I finally got to try this.

Appearance: Jet black. Poured with no head.
Aroma: Fruity nose. Bourbon sweetness.
Taste: Smoky, roasted, sweet, bourbony.
Mouthfeel: Surprisingly medium body for a stout.

Simply amazing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from 12 oz bottle.  Nice and dark, very little head at all.  Strong aroma of Bourbons, chocolate and other dark goodness.  I have to admit, while delicious, i think Expedition is much better... i like my stouts bolder and a solid kick to the chin and nose.  This is a subtle treat.... but Im not convinced it holds up to all the hype.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2013 2012 Vintage

Pours nearly pitch black - into a snifter. Surprisingly there is a dark brown head that sticks around for nearly the entire 50 minute duration of enjoyment. In the glass it is black as an eighth note (sorry). Gorgeous

The aroma is incredibly enticing, bringing you in with intensity and balance. Very prominent bourbon barrel characteristics - sweet vanilla and coconut, oak, and heat. Rich dark and milk chocolate and fresh coffee nearly dominate the dark fruits lying beneath. 

Tastes just as good as it smells. Big bourbon, chocolate, coffee, and sweet dark fruits. It is not a sweet bomb of a beer, there is some dryness. 

The mouthfeel is nearly full, soft carbonation and incredibly smooth. Very drinkable, do not feel the 11.8 abv at all, just a nice soothing warmth from the bourbon. 

This is a fantastic BA stout and well worth the effort to seek out a few 12oz bottles.

(Bottle 750 ml) Completely black, opaque, and beige head sticks to the sides of the snifter. First smell I get is of dark dried fruits, which I find interesting since its bourbon barrel aged. Of course you get the bourbon on the nose, but also you can smell sweetness. Alcohol is also evident in the nose. Tastes of coffee, dark dried fruits, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oakiness. Very well balanced and smooth. Not harsh at all, especially for being 11.5%. Nice aftertaste of vanilla that lingers in the mouth. Mouthfeel is full-bodied, velvety smooth and lightly carbonated. A world class beer from a world class brewery.

12oz bottle.  Finally able to get my hands on this with their new larger release of 12oz bottles.  The pour is dark with a nice rich carmel head.  The aroma is laced with bourbon, along with tons of malt and some dark fruits.  The taste gives a little but burn up front, and really throughout the drink.  A little thinner than I was expecting.  Can taste characteristics of both beers in here as well.  IMO a little disappointed given all the hype, but if it ages anything like Expedition Stout, this beer will only get better.  Just much better BA stuff out there.

Pours a dark brown with a mocha head.  Smells of bittersweet chocolate and vanilla.  The taste is quite sweet, but not as much as the aroma.  A lot of vanilla and chocolate.  There is a small amount of roast on the back end so it finishes slightly roasty and dry.  The beer is medium bodied with a creamy mouthfeel.  There is no alcohol detected in the aroma or the taste.  There is a slight warming in the throat.  Great beer.

22oz bottle, obtained in a trade, poured into a tulip.  Pours opaque black with minimal head.  Nose is roast, dark fruit, chocolate, bourbon.  Taste follows; medium bodied.  A bit disappointing that the flavor isnt more complex (to my palate anyway).  I would not say this is in the same league as Black Tuesday or BCBS.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2013 12oz bottle.  Pitch black pour with thin mocha head and no retention of any kind.  Roast, dark fruit, chocolate, and booze on the nose and taste.  Wishing for a tad more vanilla, coconut, and a thicker body but otherwise a very solid beer.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Champanes, 
this stout had a black-brown pour and made a one finger tan colored head that receded to a cover that had some open areas and a thick ring, this beer was opaque and I could not see through but I saw a mound of bubbles on the top of the beer and some bubbles flowing up the sides of the glass, it left spots and fingers of lacing on the sides of the glass, I saw no sediment in the bottle, 

this beer had aromas of bourbon, vanilla, bourbon liquor, roasted malt, caramel, some chocolate, malt and bourbon sweetness, 

it had flavors of roasted malt, bourbon, molasses, bourbon liquor and malt sweetness, there was a little burnt roasted malt notes and there was a touch of coffee flavor in the background, the finish had roasted malt with molasses and a touch of bitterness, 

the mouth feel was more than medium and had a little creaminess, 

this beer had more sweetness on the nose than on the mouth, a nice bourbon barreled Imperial stout, not too much bourbon as I find in many Imperial stouts, and not a lot of sweetness like some BB Impys, this was a nice mix of Bourbon Barrel and Imperial Stout.

Bottle from Alex @ Binnys @ Willowbrook (thanks brutha!). Pours the color youd expect of an Imperial Stout (or even a Guinness for that matter): a deep, dark opaque brown-black, but with a medium espresso colored head that dissipated fairly soon after pouring. Nose is earthy, barrel, brownie batter, and something kinda like fresh roasted hazelnuts. Mouth is big and creamy, brownie batter and bourbon barrel up front, then coffee notes and some nuttiness on the back end. Super smooth -- cant really detect the lofty ABV at all. Ive had a few stouts over the years and some that are comparable, but this is a rare one and a real treat to find in the Chicago area.
Draft: Bourbon, walnut, and potting soil nose. Quite nice. Black, with a medium beige head. Charred oak and prune flavor. Medium body, with heat on the back end. Ugh, bourbon barrel aging.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2014 Very rich and creamy. Loaded with flavors. Lots of molasses,  dark chocolate, sweet coffee, vanilla, toasted bread and of course bourbon. Hints of dark fruit, with chocolate cherries in the aftertaste. Wonderful palate, thick enough to handle a beer of this caliber.

Pretty near flawless, and if there is a flaw Im not the one to see it. Heavy musk of smoked malt, coffee and dark chocolate. Awesome taste, that never pushes or pulls too much in wrong direction with aromas and palate. Its all over your senses without exasperating anything. Bitter and a little sweet, some spice and salt. Tap at brewpub.

damn this is perfect!pours an opaque black.whith a thin brown head that qickly dissapates.minimal lacing.aroma of bourbon,chocolate,coffee and vanilla.flavor completely matches the aroma.when you smell this,you know what your about ready to taste.completely balanced.reminds me a lot of bourbon county stout other than the bourbon is a lot more balanced in the flavor.full bodied with low carbonation and an oily mouthfeel.im amazed at the lack of bitterness in this beer.not that i dont like a bitter finish but its has a slightly sweet finish with very little bitterness for an imperial stout.amazing!

Tap (2011) at the Birch for rating number 1000! Pours opaque black with a medium brown head that leaves decent lacing. Aroma is bourbon, coffee, dark roasted malt, chocolate, and a touch of vanilla. Flavor is the same, medium sweet and complex with a light coffee bitterness and just a touch of astringence. Full body, creamy mouthfeel. Warming finish from the ABV.
Pours almost black, thick creamy head. Smells of chocolate, coffee, and cream with bourbon.  Tastes of creamy chocolate, coffee, malt, bourbon, oak, spices, carbon, alcohol.  Big body, some linger.

Draft at The Birch. Black pour with a short brown head. Aroma is sweet with strong bourbon notes, oak, vanilla, caramel, roasted malt, and chocolate. Taste is big bourbon notes, oak, vanilla, burnt caramel, dark chocolate and booze. Body is medium-full with moderate warmth and stickiness, and dense carbonation. Ends with more roasted malt, caramel, bourbon notes, oak, vanilla, brown sugar and chocolate.
excellent, very big robust complex yet balanced bb stout. i think i enjoy this one more than BCS.
Pours very dark with bluish highlights.  Smells and tastes incredible - roasts, malty, chocolaty with licorice overtones.

Bottle from Brent shared at Tom s. Pours murky black with brown head that fades. Nose is slighty nutty, coffee and dark chocolate. first sip is burnt sugar, oak, boubon and dark roasted flavors.finish is molasses and bitter coffee. nice but I thought it was going to be better.

Pours thick black, dark oil in color with a great dark cocoa head. The aroma brings the sweet vanilla and roasted coffee and chocolate-like malts so nice in the nose. The body is nice and creamy and brings roasted malt and some dark chocolate flavors with just a bit of sweet and bitterness blended well to end on the palate in a pleasant manner.

Amazing scent of bourbon and mocha. Taste smooth as silk with heavy dark chocolate notes.  Bourbon is very light creating a perfect mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

FOBAB 12. Pours a black body with a finger-width, dense and creamy, dark brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is bigger bourbon and wood up front with a nice dark chocolate backing, roasts, touches of licorice, vanilla, hints of dark fruits, and some fruity pine hops. Flavor similar. Big bourbon and wood with a plethora of chocolate, roasts, some coffee, vanilla, and pine hops. Finishes dry, roasty, woody, and moderately bitter, but very rich from the chocolate and vanilla. Lengthy aftertaste following a medium-full, smooth body and a soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, a really solid beer. Very well balanced between the woody bourbon, rich malts, roasts, vanilla, and hops. Not exceptionally special, but delicious nonetheless. Great barrel aged imperial stout.

Growler, thx chuck ! 
Head: thin, semi-creamy, light espresso 
Colour: very very dark brown, almost black 
Smell: very much vanilla ,bit of malts, some brown chocolate 
Taste: start is deffinitly vanilla with a bit of coconut cream, then comes some slightly roasted malts, chocolat, no coffee tough.
overall is a slightly sweet stout with lovely creamy notes, end is a bit boozey.
Very nice !!

750 ml. bottle. Very excited to try this one. It pours a very thick black color with a small, disappearing brown head. The aroma has extremely nutty bourbon with caramel, cocoa, wood, toast and hints of vanilla. The flavor is superb with just the right balance of sweetness and attenuation. Big bourbon influence, wonderful dry, spicy barrel notes. Sweet without being cloying or syrupy. Chocolaty, caramel, nuts, spicy wood, campfire smoke. Pretty easy to drink despite the heaviness. This is awesome stuff. Just about perfect for the style.

Good, but not extraordinary. Very black with a lovely caramel color head. Brew-by-numbers in its aroma and flavor--vanilla, cream, chocolate, bourbon...its all there. But it doesnt leap out of the glass. Smooth and decent, but the sausage was better. (on tap at New Bohmeia, MInneapolis)
On tap @ New Bohemian.  Black color with a small head.  Light malt aroma.  Even after warming, not really anything.  Taste is quite alcoholic.  Rummy and some molasses.  Dry malt towards the end.

Growler. Pours oily black w thin light-brown head. Nose of molasses, licorice, bourbon, dark chocolate w alcohol noticeable. Taste is big on flavor with licorice, chocolate, caramel and bourbon. Mouthfeel is creamy and mouthcoating w alcohol burn. Complex brew.  Loved this.

On tap at New Bohemia tap takeover. Not what I was expecting. It was good but not AMAZING, as was expected. Overall its a great stout but it doesnt bring a whole lot to the table. It has a creamier Expedition stout taste. Almost no barrel flavor profile.
Old phone note: on tap at Proof.  black pour thin tan - big sweet malt wood - bourbon cola vibe, burnt wood, licorice, vanilla, graham - warm - good sipper - 8.0

Sample FOBAB 12 - First pour of the day, as I had not yet had the fortune of trying this brew - pour was nearly black with a deep tan head.  Aroma was heavy on the chocolate and some boozy accents.  Flavor was very good - dark chocolate, bourbon, dark fruit, sweet cream.  Palate was impeccable - full and silky.  Long finish - this one actually exceeded my expectations!

Pours dark brown/black with a medium mocha head.  Aroma has notable bourbon...not hot...some dark fruits and nice dark chocolate.  Flavor has plenty of bourbon...very lt booze...lots of dark chocolate and hints of coffee and dark fruits...fairly straightforward with the flavors but very rich and smooth.  Mouthfeel is medium/full and creamy with a warming bourbon/dark chocolate finish.

Growler thanks to maltomeal. Dark black with a small head. Huge chocolate malty with hints of barrel. Taste is very rich with chocolate, barrel, cocoa. Alcohol is present but not overbearing. Silky smooth body. Delicious.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: A nice surprise at the STL Hops 5th Anniversary party.  Pours very dark with a tan/orange head.  The aroma has smooth roast, dark chocolate, licorice, vanilla, bourbon and alcohol heat.  Quite full and rich body with soft gentle carbonation.  The taste is very rich with chocolate, big roastiness, anise, cream and warmth.  The finish is more bitter and seems to show some hoppiness.  The alcohol and cocoa comes out more forceful in the finish as well.  Very nice.  Glad I got to try this one.
Tastes of dark chocolate with a little acidy feel.  Goes down very smooth and Im not a stout person.  Definitely worth trying.

on draft and one of the best beers i have had and every bit worth its rating. poured almost black with no head. the aroma of dark roasted malt and chocalate with touches of coffee..the flavor is boozy and chocolate nibs deep and rich with flavor. absolutely incredible. could i have had more..oh hell yea...pure bliss with this one and stout lovers will agree.
UPDATED: JUN 17, 2013 Best beer Ive had this year. Dark, dark pour from tap, boozy taste (welcomed), malty, sweet, with bite.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2013 Sample draft at FOBAB.  Slight bourbon aroma.  Taste has a soft bourbon taste with a nice underlying stout flavor.  It is very smooth and very balanced but nothing that really blew me away.  Medium thickness, on the thin side for the style.  Incredibly smooth for something this big.  Overall, this is a very good beer that did not live up to my high expectations.  Initial rating of 4.1



Tried again.  This time with the new 12oz bottle.  Compared to KBS and bourbon county.  Both from 12.  A decent amount or bourbon this time.  Not quite as much as bc but close.  Much smoother than bc though.  Had aa cream taste on the back better than thei vanilla flavor some have.Really enjoyed it.  Bumped up a few ticks on that performance.
Yes! This is the bomb. On draft at Republic - had this with two other fantastic bourbon barrel beers from Bells. It is thick, dark, bourbon goodness. Lovely.
On tap at 3 Squares. Pours black with some bourbony aromas. Flavor is incredible. A great mix of bourbon, chocolate and vanilla with incredible mouthfeel. Nice and creamy. Very well done.
On tap at JL Beers Fargo. Oh, man, this was amazing, so I gave it high marks in every category.

On tap at JL Beers Fargo. I lucked into this on tap in Fargo. A fantastic beer all around. Bourbon dominates the aroma, but theres also element of coffee, dark chocolate, even the hoppiness from the Expedition Stout. Tasty. A must try.

32oz. Growler at my 30th Birthday Tasting, from a balloon snifter. Pours opaque black, with a thin dark tan head, and spotty lacing. Nose is big bourbon, just huge bourbon, so much bourbon going on here... Massive milk chocolate, toast, cashew, pecans... Flavours of toast, coconut, caramel, butterscotch, milk chocolate, brandy beans... And yet it still feels amazingly dry and restrained. This is the dead opposite of BA Dark Lord, which is so, so sweet. The dryness keeps the bourbon from being overwhelming, and balances out the rest of the beer. Just great.
Sampled at the StlHs party.   Wow isbthis good.  Black as night with a nice tan head.  Sweet chocolate and vanilla.  Rich. Mso smooth and no taste of alcohol atball.

32 oz. growler, sent from Codysjb (thanks a lot, Cody ). Pours jet black with a small light brown head. Aroma is huge on the bourbon barrels and vanilla, lots of chocolate as well, with shitloads of depth. Flavour is uber-complex with huge bourbon notes, loads of caramel malts, vanilla and some chocolate liqueur. Insanely complex and barrel-heavy giving off dominating bourbon and vanilla notes. Viscous as fuck, very thick and syrupy. For bourbon bombs, this is one of the best for sure.

Very good beer that didnt live up to my inflated expectations.  Aroma reminded me of a mikkeller stout in a good way.  Tons of roast, earth, light vanilla, bourbon.  Taste is a bit muddled but great notes of lactose and coffee.  The base beer is fantastic but the barrel aging was where it fell short for me.  A bit of slight raw bourbon or spirit flavor that doesnt seem to blend with the beer as it should.

Bottle. Stout day, my least favorite day of the year. Pours a deep black but not as viscous as I might have thought. Big tan head. Aroma is pronounced coffee and slight chocolate raisin. Taste is again, more iced coffee and toffee. Decadent to say the least. Overall, the bottle was very different than the draft pour I have had in a slightly better way.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
Sweet and very roasty. Thick and creamy,
Very light bourbon characteristics. Pretty great
On tap at the Kansas City Flying Saucer. Pours a black color with brown head. Smooth, milky, roasted, chocoloate, bourbon flavors. So smooth, yet so flavorful. Great beer.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2014 On tap at eccentric cafe. Dark black pour into snifter, half inch of beige head that settled quickly. Malty scent, brown sugar and molasses. Thick mouth feel with little carbonation. Very sweet malty, mature flavor: maple syrup, molasses, dark fruits and brown sugar. Finish is sour and a bit bitter, mouth was a little tingly. Very nice. 

April 2014 update: enjoyed 2/28/12 bottle. Super rich, super boozy aroma. Powdery, corn-y bourbon aroma, powdery Carmel is strong. Very low carbonation, somewhat thin mouthfeel, numbs the tongue on finish very slightly. Supremely rich flavor, heavy on the Carmel and molasses, dark fruits and rich dark chocolate or cocoa. Amazingly smooth and well blended compared to other BBA stouts.

Bottle. Pours with pitch black hued body. Glass coating, tan head. Medium retention. Aromas show medium to strong bourbon character, medium barrel vanillin, light coffee, low smoke, vanilla bean. Flavors are surprisingly smooth, bourbon, vanilla, bready. Low esters and a nicely clean roast character. Medium coffee. Full bodied, lower carbonation. Quite good!

~10 oz tulip/goblet type glass draft at Martin City Brewing Company.  The aroma is soft cocoa sweetness, along with Bourbon and wood barrel notes, and a nice amount roast. The taste is big sweetness, vanilla and cocoa, then moves to strong barrel, and a strong sweet alcohol finish.  The flavors are well integrated, big and bold.  The roast, cream and bourbon booze linger.  The Palate is medium bodied, low carbonation, and an oily texture leading to the finish.

On tap at Bryant Lake Bowl in September. Pours deep black. Oily, viscous, small tan head. Aroma has a bit of booziness, dark fruits, slight roastiness and sweet. I love the sweetness that is then cut by the barrel. Long sweet finish. I love this beer.  One of my favorites

Bottle,  Nice dark pour, tan foam and ight lacing. Aroma of molasses, dark fruits, bourbon, some chocolate. Taste is sweet, lots of molasses, some vanilla, dark fruits, really interesting flavor. Palate is rich, really creamy but maintains good drinkability, really well done.

Bottle 750ml, 602/1081
Pours very dark brown (black), with almost no head (beige). Aroma is of roasted malt, porto, dark fruits, bourbon, chocolate, alcohol. Taste is of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, alcohol. Very sligth smoke. Warming alcohol, booze. Palate: Srong body, but not that thick. Very creamy-like, yet drinkable (dangerously). Overall: Intense, complex, yet fairly drinkable. Very impressive.
Freakin delicious. Expedition adds deep cocoa and dark fruits. Bourbon adds sweet complexity.

Bottle (750 ml) # 602/1081. Traded by Sarro, thanks Kyle! Black with nod head and no lacing, which is understandable for a bourbon barrel beer. Aroma is wonderfully complex with notes of bourbon and vanilla (but nothing overwhelming), porto, raisins, figs, caramel, wood, roasted malt and the list goes on. Taste is about the same but on the softer side. Mouthfeel is amazingly creamy, especially for a bourbon barrel imperial stout. Alcohol is barely noticeable. Quite drinkable for the style. Wonderful BB RIS, especially regarding to aroma and mouthfeel.

10/20 on tap @ProofBrewingCompany. Pour is thick, opaque, black. Dark creamy colored head. Aroma consists of toffee and hints of bourbon. Mouthful is chocolately, toffee, and not so subtle taste of the bourban barrel. Finish is ultimately coffee dominant. ABV is well hidden, but not invisible. If only this gem wasnt so rare.
Bottle (75 cl), courtesy of rlgk. Black with beige head. Dark chocolate aroma with salmiak and tar, strong vanilla bourbon notes. Medium bodied, low carbonation. Semi sweet, medium bitterness.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2013 Pours a opaque black on tap with a thin lacing of tan head and light sticking on the way down. Aroma of dark chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, and a slight note of coffee. Taste has all of that, with slight roasted malt notes and an exceptional bourbon kick at the end. Mouth is creamy and smooth, and even though you can?t really taste the booze, it burns on the way down. Definitely as good as the hype!

750 ml bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours oily pitch black with a small dark mocha head that slowly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is slightly sweet and malty with roasted malts, quality dark chocolate, dark bread, burnt caramel, charred wood, black pepper, bourbon, coconut, vanilla fudge, asphalt, toffee and hints of sweet liquorice. Taste is sweet and malty with roasted malts, roasted coconut, quality dark chocolate, sweetened dark roast coffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, lactose, bourbon, toffee, nutella and hints of alcohol. Mouthfeel is soft, creamy, smooth, balanced, silky and full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet and bitter with roasted malts, quality dark chocolate, dark roast coffee, vanilla fudge, roasted coconuts, charred wood and bourbon. Great balance and smooth silky mouthfeel adds up to a great experience.

Bottle at USA comes to Skövde. Pitch black beer with a small brownish head. Malty milky aroma, caramel, chocolate, licorice, milky, cream, cocoa powder, peat notes, bourbon, vanilla, toffee, floral notes, oak, vanilla fudge, hay. Chocolate flavor, caramel, bourbon, oak, vanilla, fudge, hay, smoked notes, creamy, woody, hay, leather, raisins, figs, cocoa powder, licorice, spicy, smoked, hay, peat, dades, roasted, coffee notes, ash notes, hop notes, biscuits, peat notes, hay. Incredibly balanced, very drinkable and with flavors that never stops coming. Fantastic chocolate finish with cocoa powder, hay, licorice, milk and wood.

Sampled at UCTS testing. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Smells creamy vanilla and coffee. Tastes vanilla, abit herby creamy chocolate roasted malt, abit arrack. Very well balanced and incredible creamy.

Bottle rlgks tasting. Pours pitch black with a small eim of tanned head. Aroma is sweet dark fruits vanilla bourbon dill roasted malts coconut slightly alcohol chocolate. Flavor is roasted malty vanilla a bit acidy bourbon astringent alcohol bitter coffee chocolate. Finishes sweet fruity bitter. Was expecting heavier body, suprisingly drinkable.

Sampled at USSkovde
Pitch black. No head. 
sweet, vinous aroma with chocolate, coffee, salty tar. 
Surprisingly light body. 
Wooden, vinous notes. Milky chocolate.

Draft at Proof. Opaque black pour with a small tan head. Aroma of deep fudge, vanilla, roasted malts, bourbon, oak and bitter chocolates. Lots of chewy Herseys kisses in the flavor along with vanilla, brûlée crust, oak, subtle bourbon. Vicious body with hardly noticeable alcohol and a slightly bitter finish. Fucking delicious beer and a real treat.

Has the nose of bourbon, vanilla, and touch of oak, alcohol comes through too.  The heat isnt too bad on the palate, it actually has a creamy texture from the double stout.  Its rich but really tasty. Dont drink it on an empty stomach!

On tap at proof. Excited. Black pour with khaki head that fades. Aromas of wood vanilla coconut and coffee. Really enjoy the fresh cut wood aroma. Tastes of wood pulp vanilla and roasted grains. Lots of tannins.  Thinner body than expected and I like full body stouts. Absolute pleasure to try this beer. As it warms up doesnt get any more flavor. Really good beer try it if you can but dont give up the world to try it.

750 ml C&C bottle served in a Deschutes tulip. Bottle # 272/1081. Huge thanks to Andrew (nasty31) for the share. This was the night cap to the pre-DLD tasting.

A: Pours a jet black with a light khaki head forming on the pour. It recedes slowly to a thin collar that leaves some soapy looking lace across the glass.

S: Bourbon up front in the nose and slowly the dark fruits and pure chocolate start to emerge. As the glass warms the sweeter notes of caramel to show and the roasted malts also get amplified.

T: The dark fruits and the bourbon flavors are up front with smooth oak and a nice combination of dark chocolate and sweet milk chocolate. The finish is roasty with a nice addition of caramel and vanilla from the barrel.

M: Smooth and sweet with a low carbonation and chewier body. There is a mild warmth on the back end of each sip.

O: I really got the nice dark fruit and dark chocolate flavors from the Expedition Stout and the creamy malt and milk chocolate flavors from the Double Cream Stout. Overall, combined with the barrel aging this was a very nice beer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-01-2012
Motor oil with a dark brown thin head. Smells like vanilla,coffe and dark caramel. The taste is pure mocha and sweet bourbon with roasted hints., Nice!

Thanks to Owen for the bottle. 
Pours black, very thick, slightly oily looking. Dark mocha colored head with good lacing. 
Nose is of bourbon, wood, roasted grains and malts. Big nose. 
Taste and feel are quite heavy. Get a big amount of the base beer which is quite good but quite big and filling. Lots of roasted malts, slight charred ash and a lot of Vegemite and dark chocolate. Low carbonation. 
Big beer. Quite heavy. Good beer though

Autumn Brew Review 2012. A thick, heavy beer.  Very low carbonation, similar to Expedition in that way. Heavily roasted grain, with some sugar. There is bourbon in the aroma and as well as in the flavor.  AS far as bourbon-aged beers go, it is very good, but still more bourbon than I like.
Draft sample at Big Beers. This is a top-notch brew. Well worth its lofty ratings. Dangerously drinkable for such a big beer. Molasses, brown sugar, booze and a little vanilla. Yummy.

I had a sample of this at The Steel City Big Pour in Pittsburgh this September.  The beer pours out black as pitch, with a mocha head.  On the nose, I picked up vanilla, caramel, and oak barrel.  The flavors were butterscotch, toffee, smoky dark chocolate, and black olives (presumably from the barrel).  You could definitely pick up on the bourbon too, but it wasnt integrated into the beer as well as with other barrel-aged stouts.  On the whole though, this was fantastic and I feel really lucky to have tried this.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2014 Had a tasting at Michigan brewers guild. Poured black and surprisingly thin. Smells of strong sweet chocolate. Tastes like liquid tootsie rolls. Thin mouthfeel. Too sweet. Is this what everyone was raving about? Maybe a bad keg at the tasting. Was not impressed.

2012 Re-Rate: Previously a 2.9 maybe from a bad keg? got a bottle now. Pours pitch black with a very small brown head. Aroma is heavy vanilla, licorice, chocolate and bourbon. Smells very rich. Some up front bite with medium low carbonation. Flavor of licorice at first, finishing with overwhelming chocolate and then sweet vanilla really lingering.  Thick and viscous, slightly acidic with some burning alcohol goin on. Age would probably smooth it out but overall pretty awesome! Glad I got to rerate this.

Another rerate here with a 2012 bottle poured on 3/22/14. Mostly similar but the booze tones down considerably now. Big anise flavors and lots of beautiful vanilla chocolate good n plenties. This is still awesome.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2013 Perfectly potent aroma and incredibly balanced taste, perfect thick black pour and warming mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smell of toffe and chocolate.  Pours thick with very little head.  Taste of chocolate, vanilla, coffee.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Taster @ Gents Bierfestival, courtesy of tderoeck. Thanks Tim! Black coloured beer with a short brown head. Strong roasted malty and extreme alcholic hinted aroma. Very creamy full palate. Finish is chocolate, dark chocolat strong taste with a longer bitter chocolat alcoholic malty ending. Very impressive.

750mL Bottle. A million, million thanks to Sean for providing this bottle to my Bachelor-party tasting of 2002-2012 Expedition Stout. It was a great way to kick the tasting off. Aroma resounded loudly with bourbon, pure and fresh, and soft. Hints of stout roast kick in, but its mostly a bourbon show. Flavors lean surprisingly in the Double Cream stout direction. I was picking up the mineral, charred Cedar saline quality of that portion of the blend, but lacking the rich, port-like refined sugar edge of the Expy. This is very dry for an Imperial Stout, which is greatly appreciated, but I think the bourbon is a bit overwhelming and I think the Expedition portion gets shouted out a little. Overall, its a very good stout and one that Im eternally grateful to have had the opportunity to try.

On Draught at Zombie Burger
Ive got way too many of these "landmark" beers all stored up for a few hundred more ratings. Im not going to sit here and not enter this one so it can be all celebratory when I do. 

Pours basically black with a small but well retained head. 

The aroma is big & sweet with lots of fudge & bourbon notes. The alcohol is there in a pleasant bourbony kind of way, even fainter is a hint of smoke. 

The flavor is roasty and bitter, this is not without sweetness and lots of bourbon character, but this retains so much of whats great about the big awesomeness that is Expedition Stout. Plenty of chocolate, both in the dark bitter variety and the sweet fudgy variety. Some black currant and cherry fruitiness become more and more pronounced along with the woody character of the beer as it warms. 

Just wonderful.

on tap at Macs Industrial during ABR week.  Pour was jet black with a consistency of motor oil, deep ruby when swirled, puffy off-white putty lace that stuck around. Aroma was all bourbon and vanilla, with maybe a dash of anise.  Taste was more bourbon but was very smooth and not overly alcohol like BCBS can be.  smooth, thick, slightly syrupy and warming to the core.  backnotes of vanilla and roasty graham.  Delicious and I am so stoked that I finally got to try this after years of waiting/searching.
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2013 Had this at the 2012 Autumn Brew Review. Great bourbon and chocolate scent and flavors, has a great smooth body.

Bells Black Note: Approximately 2 oz. pour on tap at the Autumn Brew Review in Minneapolis on 9-15-12. Wonderful aroma. Rich, complex taste features chocolate, vanilla, and coffee flavors with a dry finish. Medium to full body. This is a very good beer, and probably the best I drank at the festival, though I have had multiple superior imperial stouts in the past. 9/4/8/4/17

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2012 1119/12 re-rate. Draft at Busters on 28th. Vanilla strong again. Some oak but in the background. Black body with beautiful tan lace. Lovely. A little dry. But refreshingly NOT black licoricey. Creamy, vanilla oak with subtle bourbon notes. 9/16/12- ABR. vanilla notes and cocoa nibs in the nose. Hint of smoke or it could be the D bag smoking next to me. Engine oil consistency. Warming. Awesome.

Lucky enough to enjoy this several times, usually small samples and, even when handbottled, traveled and then shared, this stout keeps its complexity.  The bourbon doesnt overpower and its thick, richness is mouthcoating and stays bittery chocolatey for long after swallow. Nose is vanilla and a little more chocolate than regular expedition stout.  Ive never really been able to tell if each batch was different or if this batch just keeps aging and getting passed down, as each sample Ive gad over 3 or four years has been rich, complex and fiery fresh.

On tap at Timberwood grill. Black with almost no head. Light aroma of bourbon, dates, chocolate malt. Fantastic taste with well balanced bourbon flavor and layers of malt, cream and hops. Does have some sweetness from the cream stout. Nice palate too.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Golden Crust
Aroma- onslaught of bourbon, lactose, chocolate, roasted notes, vanilla, licorice
Appearance- obviously black, thin white head
Taste- super sweet vanilla, milk chocolate, cream, bourbon, oak and other barrel qualities, slight roasted finish with more sweetness from the bourbon
Palate- good body, nice silky residue left behind on the mouth
Overall- World class brew for sure.  For some reason it took 3-4 sips to become acclaimated to my palate, but it was worth it in the end.  Very smooth and expertly blended.

Draft at Sheffields.  Black pour with almost no head. Aroma bourbon, caramel, chocolate, and dark fruits. Taste follows suit with vanilla, bourbon, toffee, chocolate, dark fruits. Thick palate. Fantastic beer.

Black colour, tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, mocha, Liquorice allsorts (Engelse drop), vanilla and quite some bourbon. Flavour roasted malts bitterness, some sweetness, alcoholic bourbon. Vanilla and light wood. Quite creamy. Finish liquorice, bourbon, mocha and chocolate.
(From 75cL bottle @ 3e GBF, shared by tderoeck. With a big thanks to BoBoChamp!)

(750ml bottle during RBWG) espresso milk chocolate brown, few bubbles. Nose of vanilla, bourbon, milk chocolate, graham cracker, and fudge. Taste of fudge, graham cracker, cream, bourbon, pretty rich, nice linger, a bit ashy, and thick body.

Appearance:  Pours a slick looking cola brown with spotty bubbles.

Aroma: Strong boozy whiskey, chocolate, fresh herbal note.

Taste: Mild burnt roast , whiskey, char. Dark chocolate.

Mouthfeel:  On the thin side of medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Overall: This is a beer I thought I would never get to try because of how hard the midwest was hoarding this beer. Im glad I did, but the hype on this beer didnt come close to my enjoyment.  I just want to be honest, this is how I approach the super hyped, highly sought after beers. My expectations get raised. Maybe its not fair to the beer?

I love Bells Expedition, I love big Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Stouts, but I dont think this particular one comes close to my top 3. This reminded me of Big Skys Ivan The Terrible for me, which was good, but not a slam dunk.  Ive heard its awesome on tap, so hopefully one day I can revisit. I surely wont be trading my cellar for it.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2013 Bottle fro. General store. Pours medium black off white head. Aroma if roast malt chocolate and dried fruit. Barrel taste is faint sweet lots of chocolate

Re rate from 12 ounce. Nose is big barrel and vanilla. Taste is super complex coconut, fig and roasted wood with rum raisin yet super smooth easy drinking love this so much more.

18/VIII/2012 75cl bottle @ 3de Gents Bierfestival (Gent) - bottle # 898/1081 (2012-952) Thanks to Bobochamp for sharing the bottle!
Clear very dark beer, no head. Aroma: vanilla, lots of caramel, bourbon, pretty sweet, raisins, charcoal, did I mention bourbon? MF: soft carbon, full body. Taste: very very chocolaty, caramel, some vanilla, bourbon, quite alcoholic. Aftertaste: lots of dark chocolate, caramel, some vanilla, bitter touches, bit earthy, cocoa powder.

Draft into a goblet. Pours black with almost no head. Coffee, chocolate, bourbon and oak, vanilla, dark fruit and some caramel. Medium bodied with a thick creamy texture. Awesome beer. Im glad i got to try it!

Pitch black pour with a creamy tan head.  Not much retention or lacing.  Smells of bourbon, dark chocolate, espresso and dark fruit.  Taste is chocolate and bourbon, followed by vanilla and a slight sweetness.  It is a superb imperial stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pitch black color with a tan head. The aroma contains espresso, chocolate, licorice, dark fruit, and burbon. Flavor is rather bitter with espresso,  dark chocolate, burbon, licorice, some raisins. The burbon is definitely there but does not overwhelm. Overall excellent damn beer. And KP showed up.
UPDATED: SEP 24, 2012 drank out of a 64 oz growler.  pours black, sweet dark fruit, coffee, raisin no head but carbonation when cracking the growler

Hand bottle. Black pour with tan head. Bourbon, chocolate, sweet malt and cream aromas, smells smooth somehow. Silky finish, flavor is sweet, has bourbon and oak tones. Nice full flavored stout with barreling not over powering the beer.

On tap at Beer Geeks. Lucky to come across this. Pours a motor oil black color with a half finger dark tan head. Beautiful looking imperial stout. Smells amazing with dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, some oak, and some coffee. Tastes very much like it smells. Starts with bitter dark chocolate and bourbon, then smooths out with sweet vanilla and oak with more chocolate and some coffee. Has a medium to full body with a nice creamy and slick texture. The oak bourbon barrels make the beer so much more complex and good. Great imperial stout.

Black pour thin tan/orange head light lacing ..... aroma of vanilla and oak, light black licorice, dark chocolate and roasted coffee ..... taste is of vanilla, light bourbon, oak, little creamy and lactose with a deep roasted and bitter hoppy bite .... you can definitely taste aspects of both beers, abv is hidden well .... hint of black licorice and as it warms light butterscotch .... finishes bitter dry and roasted ... mouthfeel was sweet, creamy and had a nice lively tingle on the tongue ...  awesome beer

Big thx to tderoeck for this one // sampled what was probably bottle nr. 898/1081 @ GBF 2012 // black with a mocha head around the sides // smell is pure velvet cake with chocolate, toffee, sweet oak, toffee, creamy, touch liquorice, milk chocolate and everything is drenched in most incredibly bourbon aroma ever, tad vinous even // taste sweet & pure creamy, sweet caramel, toffee, milk chocolate, touch liquorice and berries, milk chocolate, fruity, thick sweet coffee, vanilla oak, small touch of roast complimenting the whole, tad warming the whole is drenched in incredible bourbon // creamy, velvety // reminds me a bit of Firestone 15 but this is head and shoulders above // I thought the hype on this one was nonsense but this is crazy good

No head, pours like engine oil. Bourbon nose, vanillawood, punch-in-the-face alcohol. Less Bourbon, more smoked, ashes, BBQ coals, alcohol, fusels, and faint but intriguing flavours as artichoke. Well bodied, long-flowing alcoholenhanced flavours. Another John Mallett pearl. Just great.  Dikke merci à Ignace!

75cl, Bottle 898/1081, no mention of ABV, exclusive American brew, thx to Secret Santa!, very complex Stout, roasted/woody and slightly alcoholic/fruity, not too heavy, balanced, hazy, small head, top class!, yet very expensive!

Bottle #338 of 1081 for rate #4300: &nbsp Black pour, moderate dark beige head, foamy, fairly nice lacing. &nbsp Strong graham cracker nose, bourbon, sweet roasted malts, and soft hoppiness. &nbsp Very smooth on the tongue, sweet roastiness, strong graham cracker and bourbon. &nbsp Very smooth on the tongue. &nbsp This one is too easy to drink. &nbsp For an Imperial Stout its not overly hopped, too astringent, or a bruiser when it comes to ABV. &nbsp The 10.5% ABV is well masked. &nbsp Not overly complex, but for what it is its very smooth, clean, with all the flavors you need for a barrel aged Imprerial Stout. &nbsp Nothing dominates, comes across as well balanced. &nbsp A huge thanks to pailhead for sending this one my way!

On tap at Maduro in Madison, WI as part of the GT pre-party.  I thought this was good but a bit overhyped.  Tasted pretty much like youd expect it to taste - the coffee chocolate booziness of expo stout with the bourbon barrel vanilla notes.  I think I wouldve liked it better if it was just BA expo stout.

Big thanks to bulldogp04  for that one. Bottle looks really really good. Bottle nr 1015. Beer in the glass deep black, small head. Intense malty and dry aroma. Starts earthy-malty, dry, not too scratchy. Hints of coffee and liquorice, a bit bitter chocolate. Well balanced finish with again earthy notes. Mild bitter aftertaste. Quite drinkable for its strength. Great beer!

Aroma: massive dose of chocolate, mellow roast and coffee, caramel and molasses, nice bourbon note.  Pitch black pour, brown head which dissipates fairly quickly.  Flavor is chocolate cake, coffee and roast malts, cocoa, a hint of molasses.  Bitterness is fairly low, nice bourbon profile, creamy and smooth.  Full body, low carbonation, velvety on the palate.  Very nice.

Beer Bloggers Conference 2012 
Dark black in color, clear with a thin head.  Nice dark chocolate and coffee flavors and aroma.  The bourbon barrel aroma and flavor is awesome.  Love the bourbon finish.

Bottle at Blue Palms during RBSG 2012. Pours pitch black with a coffee-colored head. Boozy coffee and vanilla in the aroma, malty with some acidity. Gorgeous flavor, heaps of cream, sugar and vanilla complementing roasty coffee notes and a deep warm chocolatiness. Bourbon is smooth and melds well without much heat.

Served on-tap at Als of Hampden, Brass Rail and Shady McGradys all in the same week. Also out of a growler at ffej of july...Yeah, this area does not suck.

A - Pours jet black with a nice one and a half finger tall mocha colored head leaving sticky streaks of lace down parts of the glass.

S - Smells of warm bourbon, milk chocolate, vanilla, dark roasted malt, brown sugar and quite a bit of lactic creaminess. Bourbon is strong initially but the other aromas grow to help keep it in check.

T - Starts off with a big dose of warm bourbon, chocolate and some lactic creaminess from the double cream stout. Hints of vanilla, oak, brown sugar and rich coffee help to break things up and keep things interesting. Finish is pretty sweet with plenty of boozy bourbon and some dark roast, lingering on the palate long after consumption.

M - Big, full body with a TON of sweet flavors and moderate carbonation. Smooth, boozy feel throughout the glass.

O - I have missed out on trying this one a few times in the past so I was really looking forward to trying it when I saw that it went on-tap. Now that I have had it 4-5 times in the span of a week I can say that it definitely lives up to its billing.

Huge thanks to Derek, as always, for the bottle.  Black in color with a small tan head.  Aroma is almost overpowering bourbon and vanilla.  Rich chocolate and a bit of roasted malt.  Simplicity at its finest.  The flavor is similarly bold.  A touch of alcohol, intense bourbon, oak, and vanilla.  Tons of chocolate, some hints of coffee and roasted malt, and a bit of molasses.  Excellent, decadent stuff.

12 Oz pour into wide mouth glass, enjoyed
With tewaris 
A black, opaque, dense dark brown head
S roasted malt, some bourbon, woody
T very roasty, some wood, oatmeal?
M thick, almost chewy, nice light carbonation
O very good but falls short of the hype.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 05-15-2012 03:35:32

Bottle at the brunch at Blue Palms with RBSG. Big thanks to Andrew (womencantsail) for sharing this! Opaque black liquid with small tan head. Aroma of oak, coffee, bourbon, dark chocolate, licorice, pumpernickel and some booze. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with notes of oak and coffee and some light booze. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Absolutely delicious.

On tap at HLBD, pours a black/brown with a small tan head. Aroma of alcohol, bourbon, chocolate, coffee, and licorice. Taste similar to aroma with tobacco, well balanced and drinkable. This a really nice Barrel Aged stout, but for the most part it doesnt have anything other Barrel Aged stouts have the the same, more, or slightly less quality than. Well done but all around average.
Tastes of bourbon, oats, caramel, bittersweet chocolate, cereal, nuts and German chocolate cake. Heavy body. Delicious beer with an alcohol content thats a tad too high.
Great nose and flavor. Sweet taste that transitions smoothly into a bitterness that satisfies the palate

Upon first sip, in the top 5 beers I have ever had. Its a shame its so rare. Very mellow for a bourbon stout. Absolutely amazing. Wonderful when paired with desserts, ie. Kahlua soaked brownie
:)
From show assistance. This Carmel bread hay cereal beer tastes like chocolate coffee with toasted nuts. 2 cents: very good beer

Draft at Jerrys.  Black with excellent (given barrel-aging), creamy, chocolate shake head / Rich, smokey nose of tobacco, chocolate coffee, bourbon, and oak / Full body, sweet and chewy, with great balance and long, alcohol well balanced, sweet and lightly bitter finish / Winey flavors of bittersweet chocolate, dark roast coffee, caramel, bourbon, coconut, cream, and oak / A treat when found.

Bottle 24 of 1081. Virtually no head on black, looks like a wine. carbonation still there though understated.Smooth mouthfeel. Rich bourbon,not overpowering but substantial. Chocolate and coconut,  some mustiness. Better as it aired.FlandersNed, thanks for not putting it up on ebay. My bottle shared with Liam.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2012 Via trade with DtMets84.  The aroma is beautiful.  Bourbon, chocolate, molasses, licorice.  The appearance is deep black, oily, small tan head, dissipates quickly.  The flavor is Light bourbon, sweet and not overpowering, dark chocolate, molasses, licorice.  The finish is booze burn, sweet, light pine notes.  Medium to medium/thick in body, lighter than expected.  Very nice.  Thanks, Dave.
Draft to pint (from notes). Looks good; black with thin, boozy-tinted lacing. Smells excellent; bourbon and sweet malt. Tastes great; the blend goes wonderful with the barreling. This is great stuff!

Tap, second tasting, but first rating entry. Dark tan head, nearly jet black body. Nice bourbon, oak, vanilla, dark chocolate, roast and ripe dark fruits. Bourbon forward at first, bitter roasted maltiness that smooths out to woody vanilla and savory flavors. medium to heavier body. Warming, rich, but not overdone on any level. Worth the hype.

Draught pours black with a brown head. Aromas of coffee,roasted malt, boubon, oak, and anise.  Tastes are coffee, roasted malt, and boubon with light oak notes and some molasses. Also get dates or dark fruitines. Not too much bourbon or oak and not too sweet.  Mouthfeel is sticky and body is thick with a lingering boubon finish.  Overall, very nicely done.

Draft at ChurcKey. Black, thick brown head, fair retention, solid lacing.  Aroma of dark milk chocolate, toffee, booze and espresso. Taste is boozy coffee, prunes, dates.  Amazing mouthfeel.  Very nice but over hyped.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2012 Bottle from trade (4 Beats involved?). Tasted this one side-by-side with KBS (previously rated), and Black Note is so much smoother on the palate (much better pH balance) and less coffee. Aroma was of sweet licorice, bourbon, and dark chocolate/cacao. Flavor was a creamy version of the aroma. This beer is simply freakin amazing. Loved it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft at Churchkey in D.C.
